privateEncounter.name: Instance: Unravelling the Thread
privateEncounter.description: <u>Unravelling the Thread</u> \qStrider and the Rangers pursue their fallen brother Amdir to the Blackwolds' camp, but not all is as it seems....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Blackwold's Broken
privateEncounter.description: <u>Blackwolds Broken</u> \qAmdir's defeat shattered the back of the Blackwolds, but pieces of the mystery remain unsolved....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Assault on Archet
privateEncounter.description: <u>Assault on Archet</u> \qJon Brackenbrook and his hunters have reached the outskirts of Archet to find it already ablaze! A desperate struggle to save their village is about to begin. Hopefully you have arrived in time....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Red-pass
privateEncounter.description: <u>Red-pass</u> \qThe Gaunt-lord Ivar spreads corruption through Agamaur, the Red Swamp, raising a host of evil to do the bidding of Angmar....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Retake Weathertop
privateEncounter.description: <u>Retake Weathertop</u> \qWeathertop... once a watchtower of the Dúnedain, now a refuge for Orcs. Candaith the Ranger strives to break their foothold in the Weather Hills....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Beneath the Greenfields
privateEncounter.description: <u>Beneath the Greenfields</u> \qThe goblins of Mount Gram have never forgotten their defeat at the hands of the Shire-folk, and revenge has brought them hither once more....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Gift for the North
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Gift for the North</u> \qThe Stone-troll of Rushock Bog... a terrible legend stalks the fens, enraged by the dwarves who seek to capture it....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Skorgrím's Tomb
privateEncounter.description: <u>Skorgrím's Tomb</u> \qIt would seem that Gormr and the Dourhands have allied themselves with evil fell spirits of Old, just as Skorgrím himself did long ago. Now Ivar the Bloodhand, a Gaunt-lord, threatens to sway the Dourhands to evil with the terrifying ritual about to take place in Skorgrím's Tomb....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Burglar's Errand
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Burglar's Errand</u> \qMedhrod, a legendary sword once wielded by a great hero who helped keep the Great East Road clear of threats, has been stolen by the half-orcs of Naerost, leading Palma Brownlock, a hobbit-burglar of no small reputation, to gather allies to recover it....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Thief in the Night
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Thief in the Night</u> \qThe hobbit-burglar Atherol Took has learned that some of the Big Folk who have been causing trouble in the Southfarthing of the Shire are planning to sneak onto Farmer Maggot's land and steal his mushrooms. Atherol has no intention of allowing hobbit-mushrooms to be stolen by Men....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Lore-master's Will
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Lore-master's Will</u> \qThe Elf-loremaster Isferon received a gift from his friend Berenin before he passed over the Sea, but the gift is wrapped in a riddle. Before the gift can be revealed Berenin's puzzle must be solved....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Well-Ordered Mind
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Well-Ordered Mind</u> \qDorset Oakes, the son of a Lore-master now dead, seeks the knowledge contained in his father's old library and is prepared to hunt for the pages to the catalogue his father had written; however, goblins have been digging in the caves near the library and may soon break through....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Hunter's Charge
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Hunter's Charge</u> \qAfter receiving word of a pack of Wargs making their way into the Shire, land of the hobbits, the huntress Gytha Lainey has recruited the best hunters to track and slay the evil Wargs before they can harm any of the Shire-folk....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Hunter's Path
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Hunter's Path</u> \qA terrible and vicious wolf called Yellowfang stalks through the Old Forest, often ambushing travellers upon the Great East Road. The accomplished huntress Gytha Lainey is resolved to ridding the Forest of this savage threat....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Unmarked Trail
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Unmarked Trail</u> \qAn ancient evil, a corruption of the very nature of Middle-earth, threatens to spread its vile poison throughout the Trollshaws. This evil must be thwarted before it can be brought to bear against the hidden vale of Rivendell.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Last Refuge
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Last Refuge</u> \qSkorgrím's Dourhands have taken refuge from the wrath of Durin's Folk within an ancient dwarf-hold high in the passes of the Misty Mountains. There, they plot their return, unless an end can be put to their scheming once and for all....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Gates of Carn Dûm
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Gates of Carn Dûm</u> \qUsing the scroll of the Hillmen, a key to the gates of Carn Dûm has been forged. Now the Heroes of Eriador and Lorniel, daughter of Golodir, must pass the gates of the iron fortress and free the Ranger from the clutches of Mordirith, the Steward of Angmar....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Minstrel's Hope
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Minstrel's Hope</u> \qSeveral citizens of the besieged town of Trestlebridge have taken refuge in nearby caves, hoping to wait out the siege, but the Orcs have become aware of the townsfolk's hiding place. It is up to the minstrel Leigh Putnam and her friends to warn them....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Song for the Company
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Song for the Company</u> \qHoping for some new material with which to compose a song, the minstrel Piper Prescott has recruited young blood to aid the hobbit Leland Underhill retrieve some goods stolen from him by the brigands encamped throughout Bree-land....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Captain's Standard
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Captain's Standard</u> \qDwarves of the Dourhand house have taken refuge in the ruins of Ost Galumar, not far from the mines of Othrikar, stirring the Longbeards of Othrikar to action. Jarl Copperbrace recruits the bravest of the brave to deal with the threat of the Dourhands....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Defence of Trestlebridge
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Defence of Trestlebridge</u> \qThe little town of Trestlebridge is all that stands between the Orcs of Angmar and Bree-land to the south. Halbarad, Ranger of the North, gathers heroes to help defend Trestlebridge from the approaching onslaught....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Champion's Courage
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Champion's Courage</u> \qMosal-ruk, leader of the Orcs of Ost Cyrn, gathers his strength to crush the Eglain of the Lone-lands and press westward to Bree-land. Slade Ransford, a champion of the common good, stands ready with his allies to turn back the Orkish war-band....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Guardian's Duty
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Guardian's Duty</u> \qThe town of Trestlebridge is under siege by Orcs out of Angmar. One of the guardians of Trestlebridge, Severin Wheeler, has assembled the townsfolk and their southern allies to defend the town against the marauding hordes....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Assault on Rath Teraig
privateEncounter.description: <u>Assault on Rath Teraig</u> \qThe combined forces of Lord Dwalin of Thorin's Hall and Dorongúr Whitethorn of Duillond prepare to march upon the goblin-army at Rath Teraig....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Rescue by Moonlight
privateEncounter.description: <u>Rescue by Moonlight</u> \qAvorthal had been moved from the Dourhand encampment to a ship preparing to depart for an unknown port in the North. His rescue is paramount to maintaining peace in Ered Luin....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: To Avert a War
privateEncounter.description: <u>To Avert a War</u> \qThe Ranger Langlas prepares to mount an effort to rescue the Elf-prince Avorthal from the clutches of the treacherous Dourhands....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Othrongroth
privateEncounter.description: <u>Othrongroth</u> \qAn unholy alliance is forged within the depths of Othrongroth, the Great Barrow, a sinister pact which could spell doom for Eriador....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Frodo's Burden
privateEncounter.description: <u>Frodo's Burden</u> \qI am concerned for Frodo, for he bears a great burden. It is my hope that those whom I have sent to watch over the hobbit will determine if his mind remains strong enough for the task for which he has been chosen....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: To a Ranger's Aid
privateEncounter.description: <u>To a Ranger's Aid</u> \qAmdir, quickly falling into the shadows of the wraith-world, has slain two of his brethren already and seeks the blood of a third....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Carn Dûm
privateEncounter.description: <u>Carn Dûm</u> \qCarn Dûm, the capital of Angmar and the former stronghold of the Witch-king. Angmar's shadow has returned to this city in the form of the False King, Mordirith, Steward of Angmar.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Road Through the Dark
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Road Through the Dark</u> \qWhile out for a night-time stroll in the Shire, there is a certain unpleasant feeling lingering about...something on the air is strange tonight. Perhaps it is only the unseasonable chill, or the great darkness of this particular evening. But surely it is nothing noteworthy, for this is the Shire, and it is rare indeed for any evil to touch this land.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Jailbreak
privateEncounter.description: <u>Jailbreak</u> \qA chance encounter with brigands upon the road leads to captivity. You awaken with the Ranger, Strider, before you. As he urges you to act quickly, you realize that you have become involved in matters much greater than yourself....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Refuge of Edhelion
privateEncounter.description: <u>Into the Silver Deep</u> \qWhile visiting the Refuge of Edhelion under the care of your master, you find yourself in the midst of a brutal attack by greedy dwarves of the Dourhand family. Their king, Skorgrím, thirsts for power with an unnatural lust, and you are in the eye of the storm.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Into the Silver Deep
privateEncounter.description: <u>Into the Silver Deep</u> \qWhile about to begin your long day of work at the Silverdeep Mine, an old Man beckons for you to come near. He is a close advisor of Thorin Oakenshield, the master of these halls. What could he have to say to a simple miner such as yourself?\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Newbie Archet
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Newbie Archet

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Newbie Thorin's Halls
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Newbie Thorin's Halls

privateEncounter.name: Thorin's Halls
privateEncounter.description: <u>Skorgrím's Tomb</u> \qIt would seem that Gormr and the Dourhands have allied themselves with evil fell spirits of Old, just as Skorgrím himself did long ago. Now Ivar the Bloodhand, a Gaunt-lord, threatens to sway the Dourhands to evil with the terrifying ritual about to take place in Skorgrím's Tomb....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Hideout
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Hideout</u> \qThe hunt for Amdir leads to the hideout of the brigand Skunkwood, but to what end is unknown....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Great Barrow
privateEncounter.description: <u>Othrongroth</u> \qOthrongroth, the Great Barrow, the oldest and largest of the Edain mounds within the Barrow-downs... And home to some of the most terrifying servants of the Witch-king.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Broken Alliance
privateEncounter.description: <u>Broken Alliance</u> \qAfter learning of a plot by Sharkey's Men to forge an alliance with the Orcs encroaching into the northern Bree-fields, the Ranger Saeradan sets into motion a plan to break the alliance before it can be established....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Garth Agarwen
privateEncounter.description: <u>Garth Agarwen</u> \qGarth Agarwen . . . The ruins of an ancient fortress of Rhudaur, now overrun by corrupted nature and a vile necromantic power out of Angmar. The most terrible power still remains to be confronted.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Thrór's Hammer
privateEncounter.description: <u>Thrór's Hammer</u> \qDwalin, lord of Thorin's Hall has tasked the Heroes of Eriador with recovering Thrór's hammer from the tomb of Skorgrím, where the Dourhands have enshrined it as a memorial of victory over Durin's Folk....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Fornost
privateEncounter.description: <u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Urugarth
privateEncounter.description: <u>Urugarth</u> \qLying on the outskirts of Carn Dûm is the fortress of Urugarth, home to countless Orcs, goblins, and other curs of Angmar.... The breeding grounds of Angmar's horde.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Fire and Ice
privateEncounter.description: <u>Fire and Ice</u> \qElrond Halfelven fears that the remaining Nazgûl has enlisted the aid of the Gaunt-lord Drugoth to instill a fell spirit into the frozen corpse of the ancient Dragon Thorog and raise the beast once more as a wight. Little time remains to stop their evil plans.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Helegrod
privateEncounter.description: <u>Helegrod</u> \qHelegrod... Once a dwarf-hold in the Misty Mountains, until the coming of a great dragon. Though the dragon has long since perished, and the ice of many long winters has engulfed the ruins, rumours out of the North speak of a terrible shadow returning to the frozen halls....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Blade That Was Broken
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Blade That Was Broken</u> \qThe time of Isildur's Heir is at hand. With the recovery of the last Silithar, Elrond has commanded that the light of Narsil, which cut the One Ring from the hand of Sauron, be renewed and rekindled as Anduril, the Flame of the West....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Tomb of Elendil
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Tomb of Elendil</u> \qRespect, the one thing Gwindeth desired most, has earned passage into the tomb of Elendil, the resting place of the last Silithar. But with the lowering of the floods, robbers and thieves have taken the opportunity to plunder the tomb....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Barad Gúlaran
privateEncounter.description: <u>Barad Gúlaran</u> \qHaving obtained all the tools they need to contain a terrible spell, the sorcerers of Angmar retreat to Barad Gúlaran to fulfil the commands of their mistress Amarthiel, while the Rangers of the North seek to hinder them....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Twisted Heart
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Twisted Heart</u> \qLongbough the Ent has been roused to anger. The Wood-trolls of the Eavespire are acting in league with a Black Huorn which was once under the Ent's guidance, and Longbough is determined to put an end to their mischief....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Thieftaker's Bane
privateEncounter.description: <u>Thief-taker's Bane</u> \qA simple quest to recover ancient Dúnedain relics from the hands of the grave-robbers who stole them has gone terribly awry. The thieves will not allow the Rangers and their allies to take their treasures from them so easily....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Formal Complaint
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Formal Complaint</u> \qAn attempt to lodge a formal complaint on behalf of the glassblower, Hob Hillbrow, led to a violent encounter with the Chief's Men. The time has come to put the ruffians in their place....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Oakheart's Might
privateEncounter.description: <u>Oakheart's Might</u> \qA mysterious note from the strange Sara Oakheart bade the heroes who saved her meet her at the gates of Barad Gúlaran, the ancient retreat of the Witch-king of Angmar. Seeking an answer to the mystery of the old woman, Golodir assents....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Amarthiel's Friends
privateEncounter.description: <u>Amarthiel's Hope</u> \qSuspecting that Amarthiel, the champion of Angmar, has come to Annúminas -- a suspicion supported by the warning of the Elf Laerdan -- the Rangers of the North prepare to infiltrate the ruined city and put an end to her evil plans....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Annuminas Gardens
privateEncounter.description: <u>Glinghant</u> \qGlinghant, the gardens of Annúminas -- once a place of great beauty, now overgrown and fallen into ruin. The stagnant waters of the gardens have become corrupted by the fell spirits of Angmar, and evil Men do their bidding....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Annuminas Palace
privateEncounter.description: <u>Ost Elendil</u> \qThe Black Númenóreans in league with Amarthiel have come to Ost Elendil, seeking to establish a foothold in Annúminas, while the Rangers of the North assail the city of their fathers in a desperate attempt to drive them forth.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Annuminas Tomb
privateEncounter.description: <u>Haudh Valandil</u> \qThe Lords of Umbar, sorcerers trained by Sauron, the great Necromancer, seek to bring terror to Annúminas by raising the long-dead remains of Valandil, third King of Arnor, as a terrible wight. Only the most courageous of the Free Peoples will be able to put an end to their evil deeds....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Eye of Angmar
privateEncounter.description: <u>Barad Tironn</u> \qLaerdan, succumbing to the whisperings of Mordrambor, foolishly seeks to confront Amarthiel at Barad Tironn, where she seeks to use the palantír to find Narchuil. The only hope for the Free Peoples is for the palantír to be recovered from her grasp....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Springing the Trap
privateEncounter.description: <u>Springing the Trap</u> \qThe Rangers of the North have learned that Mordrambor, a Black Númenórean deep in the counsels of Amarthiel, is travelling to Haudh Elendil with a small retinue. Hoping to seize Mordrambor, the Rangers stage an ambush....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Mordirith's Fall
privateEncounter.description: <u>Mordirith's Fall</u> \qHeartened by the gift of Dúnachar from Elrond of Rivendell, Golodir prepares to assail Carn Dûm and drive the sword into the unseen heart of Mordirith, the murderous Steward of Angmar. Courage may bring hope, but a thirst for vengeance could spell doom....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Bounty Hunter
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Bounty Hunter</u> \qBasil Gummidge hired adventurers from throughout Eriador to bring the ruffians and tomb-robbers of Evendim to justice, but now a notorious tomb-robber, Cuthbert Sprunt, has placed a bounty upon the arbiter's own hunters....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu</u> \qWithin the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu, Angmar mines for the ore they need to arm their legions. In their search for iron, they have uncovered the home of the Eldgang, as well as a hidden evil, ancient beyond knowledge....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Trap for the Creature Gollum
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Trap for the Creature</u> \qGarbert, a fisherman in Tâl Bruinen, believes a trap can be set for the skulking creature which has terrorized the scattered inhabitants remaining in the region. Nevertheless, the creature has been a wary and cunning opponent....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Prisoner of the Free Peoples
privateEncounter.description: <u>Prisoner of the Free Peoples</u> \qThe pages of Sara Oakheart's journal uncovered the way into the ruins of Delossad, once called Sithad in brighter days. The search for Narchuil has led here, but to what end? What have these ragged stones seen...?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Mordrambor
privateEncounter.description: <u>Mordrambor</u> \qThe time has come. Angered by Mordrambor's treacherous betrayal of Laerdan, the Ranger Calenglad is determined to confront the Black Númenórean and learn where Narchuil, the ring of Amarthiel, resides. . . .\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Remembrance
privateEncounter.description: <u>Remembrance</u> \qToo many of the Dúnedain have fallen to the ravages of one who is their distant kinsman. There is a time for mourning, but is this that time, when the Champion of Angmar might secure her ring, Narchuil. . . ?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Goblin-town Throne Room
privateEncounter.description: <u>Goblin-town Throne Room</u> \qIn the darkest depths of Goblin-town, at the heart of the goblin kingdom, teeming with the vile breed, lay the throne room of the Great Goblin. Long have the inhabitants of Goblin-town been leaderless, but as the Shadow in the East grows, calling its minions to arms, a new leader has taken the mantle of the Great Goblin....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Half-truths
privateEncounter.description: <u>Half-truths</u> \qElrond Halfelven has called a council together to determine the fate of Narchuil, the ring of Amarthiel, and to question Laerdan concerning his former captor....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Barad Tironn
privateEncounter.description: <u>Barad Tironn</u> \qA clue found upon the body of one of the Angmarim reveals that the Elf Laerdan may still be held at Barad Tironn in Annúminas, where he was captured by Amarthiel's minions. It can only be hoped that he yet lives.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Laerdan's Escape
privateEncounter.description: <u>Laerdan's Escape</u> \qÉin, the questioner left behind at Barad Tironn, revealed that Laerdan had been moved from Annúminas and taken to Sammath Baul in Angmar. Time is running short for the Elf-lord.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Weapons of the Enemy
privateEncounter.description: <u>Weapons of the Enemy</u> \qPlagued by terrible dreams in the House of Elrond, Laerdan reveals in his sleep that Amarthiel's ring, Narchuil, is being held in the fastness of Barad Dúrgul.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Rite of Clúcath
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Rite of Clúcath</u> \qThe free Hillmen of the Trév Gallorg have long been in conflict with many of their sister tribes. Now they prepare to again face the Trév Duvardain in the Rite of Clúcath, a ceremonial rite of judgement...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Matron and the Master
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Matron and the Master</u> \qTwo terrible beasts, Bangrath and Murragrath, threaten the safety of the Trév Gallorg, the Hillmen of Aughaire. Their reign of terror must be put to an end.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Emissary of the Dourhands
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Flickering Flame</u> \qWith the downfall of Skorgrím, the Dourhands have become leaderless. In desperation, they have sent an emissary to Minas Angos to renew the alliance that their late lord forged with Angmar, an alliance which cannot be allowed to survive...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Emissary of Goblin-town
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Flickering Flame</u> \qSpurred by the call of the Dark Lord, the goblins of the Misty Mountains have sent an emissary to Minas Maur to treat with the Iron Crown. If these two forces unite, there may be no stopping Angmar from sweeping through Eriador...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Emissary of the Nomads
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Flickering Flame</u> \qMany are the Hillmen of Angmar who have chosen to serve the Iron Crown. Now they seek further favour from their dark masters by sending an emissary to Minas Agar. If the Hillmen cannot be dissuaded, Eriador will surely fall...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Emissary of the White-hand
privateEncounter.description: <u>Emissary of the White-hand</u> \qIn the South, Saruman builds his strength at Isengard. Despite past conflicts with Angmar, he has sent an emissary to Minas Caul to forge an alliance between the White Hand and the Iron Crown...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Seven Swords
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Seven Swords</u> \qWith the aid of the Heroes of the North, the Ranger-scholar Nethraw has reclaimed seven swords which were given to the Hillman-chieftains of old. Now Nethraw and his allies prepare to enter the ancient halls of Krúslë Lannan....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Ancient Lair
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Ancient Lair</u> \qFonn, one of the Hillmen of the Trév Gallorg, sent a scout to an ancient cave in Malenhad, the brimstone swamp, where many Gertheryg were observed gathering. The scout, Bethan, never returned, and Fonn fears he may have been taken by the trolls.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Secret Club
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Secret Club</u> \qSomething evil is afoot in the Shire. Brigands in the employ of someone calling himself the Chief have overrun the town of Dwaling. Ponto Oats intends to give the Chief's enforcer in Dwaling second thoughts about trifling with the Shire-folk.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Path of Aearil
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Path of Aearil</u> \qYrjänä revealed the location of a cave where Aearil, the captain of the Elf-ship Thoroval, had long ago taken refuge. The Lossoth seer, Saija, guides the heroes from the South in search of Narchuil....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Hand of Angmar
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Hand of Angmar</u> \qYrjänä, the chieftain of Sûri-kylä, desires to aid the Free Peoples of the South in their hunt for Narchuil, the ring of Amarthiel, but he fears the threats of Mordrambor....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Defence of Trestlebridge
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Defence of Trestlebridge</u> \qThe little town of Trestlebridge is all that stands between the Orcs of Angmar and Bree-land to the south. Halbarad, Ranger of the North, gathers heroes to help defend Trestlebridge from the approaching onslaught....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Ties That Bind
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Ties That Bind</u> \qKaj, the chieftain's son, is in love with Pinja, a young woman with a heritage drawing from many tribes. Unable to show her his true feelings, he invokes an ancient ritual which allows a warrior to capture a bride from a rival tribe....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Forges of Khazad-Dûm
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Forges of Khazad-dûm</u> \qAt the height of Durin's reign, the Forges of Khazad-dûm were once famed for producing great crafts of beauty and majesty. Now they have fallen into misuse by the Orcs which now infest the ancient halls of Moria, spewing forth their terrible tools of war....\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Hollin Gate
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Hollin Gate

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Fall of Moria
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Fall of Moria</u> \qToo deep and too greedily the dwarves delved. Little did they know what darkness truly lay in the deep places of the Misty Mountains, but Durin would not be dissuaded. Alas, what sorrow and shadows would come to Moria....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Forgotten Treasury
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Forgotten Treasury</u> \qMany ancient halls lie hidden beneath ages of ruin within the walls of Moria. The dwarves seek to recover and protect their treasures of old, while the Orcs seek to exploit them. Soon, the Forgotten Treasury may become a battleground of terrible proportions....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Fellowship Departs
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Fellowship Departs</u> \qThe household of Elrond Halfelven gather to bid farewell to nine brave adventurers, entrusted with a secret task which could mean the salvation or doom of Middle-earth... I, Gandalf the Grey, must lead them along dark roads....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Battle for Aughaire
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle for Aughaire</u> \qMordirith, the Steward of Angmar was believed defeated, but such hope was in vain. According to the armies of Angmar, Mordirith has returned and now stretched forth his hand to crush the Trév Gallorg in Aughaire....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Battle Before the Rammas Deluon
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle Before the Rammas Deluon</u> \qThe might of Angmar rallies to defeat the Trév Gallorg. Reinforcements from Urugarth and Carn Dûm march through the swamp of Malenhad towards Rammas Deluon. It falls to the Champions of Eriador to stop them....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Battle of Rhunendin
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle of Rhunendin</u> \qThere is a chance to bring security to Aughaire, for at least a little while, but it will require courage of the greatest magnitude. The armies of Angmar must be met upon their own land... they must be defeated at Rhunendin....\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Laerdan's Room
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Laerdan's Room

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Skin of Bregmor
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Skin of Bregmor</u> \qThe Champions of Eriador have been thwarted in their attempts to hinder Angmar's plans. All that remains to them now is to keep Angmar from claiming the hide of the dragon Bregmor....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Doom of the North
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Doom of the North</u> \qAngmar has gathered all they need to kindle the forges of Eregion. The Champions of Eriador must now travel to Mirobel and do whatever they must to foil the plans of Amarthiel....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Heraldry of Lindon
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Heraldry of Lindon</u> \qIn the confusion which ensued during the abandonment of Dolendath, many things were left behind by Golodir's company, not the least of which was the breastplate of the Elf-lord Laerdan. But other things lie there as well... best left buried....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Prisoner of Sammath Baul
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Prisoner of Sammath Baul</u> \qIn Sammath Baul, the Elf-lord Laerdan was tormented, both in body and mind. Even Elves can only endure for so long, though Laerdan resisted to the last. When pain alone proved ineffective, Amarthiel turned to deception....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Fate of Laerdan
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Fate of Laerdan</u> \qLaerdan's delusion is complete. Once Narchuil is restored, he will give it to Amarthiel, hoping to bring back his daughter. In folly, he will doom Eriador to fall beneath the Shadows of Angmar....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Dâr Narbugud
privateEncounter.description: <u>Dâr Narbugud</u> \qThe Elves of Lórien have uncovered Dâr Narbugud, the lair of the Mistress of Pestilence, the vile creature responsible for the plague spreading among the creatures of Moria. What heroes will overthrow the queen of the nameless? Who will put an end to her plague?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Grand Stair
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Grand Stair</u> \qIn elder days, this place once served as a grand portal to many levels and halls within Moria, but since the ruin of Moria, it has become a den of many Orc-tribes. Mazog, he who rules the Orcs of Moria, exacts his tribute here through his minion Igash....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Fil Gashan
privateEncounter.description: <u>Fil Gashan</u> \qFil Ghashan is the stronghold of Talug, right hand of Mazog, Lord of Moria. Here, the Orc-general musters an army to make a futile assault upon Lothlórien. Here, he also breeds Orc-warriors of a most deadly skill....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Vile Maw
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Vile Maw</u> \qWhither did the Watcher in the Water flee when it was driven from its lake? The Vile Maw would be my guess. Beneath the waters of the dark flood are ways which lead into the black depths of Moria....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Halls of Crafting
privateEncounter.description: <u>Halls of Crafting</u> \qThere were no greater craftsmen than the Dwarves of Khazad-dûm. Those days are now gone, and Mazog's Orcs, with the aid of Black Uruks from Dol Guldur, have taken the ancient crafting halls of Moria to forge their vile weapons of war.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Library at Tham Mírdain
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Library at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe Library at Tham Mírdain once held much of the knowledge of the early Ages and withstood the brunt of Sauron's attack against Eregion. Though much of the surviving lore was carried away by Elrond Halfelven, the forces of Angmar now seek the remnants....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The School at Tham Mírdain
privateEncounter.description: <u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Sixteenth Hall
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Sixteenth Hall</u> \qThe dread malady that spreads among the servants of the Enemy in Moria is strong in the Sixteenth Hall. Whatever nameless thing dwells there has entrapped many an Orc to its service, poisoning their minds and controlling their actions.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Skûmfil
privateEncounter.description: <u>Skûmfil</u> \qSince the overthrow of Moria, the Orcs have disposed of their dead in the great chasm they call Skûmfil. Over the ages, the rotting pile of carcasses and filth that has accumulated there has also attracted many foul and disgusting creatures, from the vile Gredbyg to the scavenging Kergrim....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Dark Delvings
privateEncounter.description: <u>Dark Delvings</u> \qIn the deepest delvings of Moria dwell nameless things which shun the light and feed on the darkness. The Elves of Lórien strive to constrain the vile creatures, but led by the evil Gurvand, they may be too strong to hold back forever....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Before the Doors of Durin
privateEncounter.description: <u>Before the Doors of Durin</u> \qLong have Durin's Folk desired to look upon the halls of Moria once again, to reclaim their birthright from the goblins and Orcs who now dwell there. Has that time now come? Not even I can foresee their fate....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Watcher in the Water
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Watcher in the Water</u> \qDire is the creature called the Watcher in the Water by the dwarves, an ancient evil called forth by the Dark Lord. Perhaps through the power of legend, a way can be seen past the terror...?\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Ghost Forge
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Ghost-forge</u> \qThe ancient tomb of a great dwarf-smith of Khazad-dûm is now the site of a terrible evil. A Cargûl in the service of the Nine has come to the forge, and with him many fell spirits, and has put the fires of the forge to evil use....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Training Hall
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Training Hall</u> \qMany armouries and forges of the dwarves lie dormant in Khazad-dûm, awaiting the hands of their masters. One such has been claimed by the Orcs of Moria for a training hall. If the forge is to see service again, the Orcs must be driven forth...\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Mithril Slaves
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Mithril Slaves</u> \qDwarves are not alone in their search for mithril. Orcs and goblins toil within the barren mines, seeking some small vein of Moria-silver to use against the Free Peoples, or at the least to keep it from them....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Spider Nest
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Spider Nest</u> \qThe returning dwarves go heedlessly into the dark of Moria. Their scouts, seeking a lost forge, find instead a nest of deadly spiders. The spiders prefer the blood of the living, and so there is still hope for their rescue....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Morroval Outcasts
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Morroval Outcasts</u> \qIn the deep places of Moria, an ancient and hidden dwarf-forge has been penetrated by an outcast band of merrevail, seeking the tools which lie there in disuse. To what ends such creatures might put them remains unknown....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Library of Steel
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Library of Steel</u> \qThe Library of Steel contains many secrets of the smithy, protected by the wards of the dwarves, for which they are well-known. Now the Ghâsh-hai seek to summon lesser fire-spirits to break the wards and ravage the library and the forge within....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Midnight Raid
privateEncounter.description: <u>Midnight Raid</u> \qThe servants of Saruman have laid claim to the ancient forges of Eregion. Savage Dunlendings have raised their encampment around one such forge. The men of Dunland must be routed if the crucibles of the forge are to burn once more....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: A Flight of Drakes
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Flight of Drakes</u> \qPembar, the resting place of one of the famed forges of Eregion, has fallen beneath the shadow of the drake-matron Rimlug and her brood. The great Wing-mother and her spawn must be defeated if the forge is to be awakened once more....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Leader of the Foul Wood
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Leader of the Foul Wood</u> \qZagâfum, leader of the Wood-trolls of Glâd Ereg, has been discovered. The corruption that the Wood-trolls are inflicting upon the forest is unfathomable, and worse, unnatural. I cannot help but believe Saruman has his hand in the matter.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Empty Passage
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Empty Passage</u> \qThe Heart of Fire, the great forging room where Durin's Axe was birthed was lost in ages past, but the discovery of the Way of Smiths would bring fresh hope to those who seek to reclaim the glory of Khazad-dûm....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: They Mined Too Fast
privateEncounter.description: <u>They Mined Too Fast</u> \qMithril it is called by the Elves, and true-silver in the Common Tongue, but the dwarves do not share their own secret name. The hope of finding it has led many dwarves to their doom in Moria, for they seldom heed the dire warnings when their hearts yearn for mithril, cold and bright in the dark.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Siege of Barad Morlas
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Siege of Barad Morlas</u> \qThe kindred of Elrond Halfelven have driven forth the half-orcs from Barad Morlas, but the ancient ruin is not yet safe. Dunlendings march even now upon the encampment, while the Elves tend to their wounds....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The White-Hand in Darkness
privateEncounter.description: <u>The White-hand in Darkness</u> \qSaruman's attempts to bring the Orcs of Moria under his sway will only be ended when his minions perish. The valour of the dwarves must be relied upon in these dark times. At Stazgnâkh, the White Hand must be cut off....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Cooling Chamber
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Cooling Chamber</u> \qAbove the great forges of Khazad-dûm lies a chamber that was used to cool the rising steam and return it as water to the pools of Moria. What purpose could goblins have within the walls of that ancient chamber?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Umukh-kanon
privateEncounter.description: <u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Kheled-menem
privateEncounter.description: <u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Menem-nar
privateEncounter.description: <u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Khibir-zamu
privateEncounter.description: <u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Gamilnafûk
privateEncounter.description: <u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Khibir-zarur
privateEncounter.description: <u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Zurr-tharûkh
privateEncounter.description: <u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Mezel-katub
privateEncounter.description: <u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: New Devilry
privateEncounter.description: <u>New Devilry</u> \qWith the absence of the Balrog, other powers less great, yet terrible still, have arisen in the dark places. Mazog has sent his Orcs into the Shadowy Abyss to entreat or control these powers...though it may prove his undoing....\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Delossad
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Delossad

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Delossad
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Delossad

privateEncounter.name: Instance: One Hope Remains
privateEncounter.description: <u>One Hope Remains</u> \qWielding the broken sword Dunachar, Narmeleth leads a party by secret ways into the stronghold of Gador Gúlaran to face Mordirith, the Steward of Angmar, and Mordrambor his servant. It is hoped that Mordirith will remember the pain Dunachar inflicted upon him....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Daughter of Strife
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Daughter of Strife</u> \qAges ago, in the fastness of Eregion, the Dark Lord came in fair guise. Some among the Elves called him Antheron Gift-lord, for he taught them to craft the Rings of Power. In those days, he beguiled Narmeleth daughter of Laerdan and broke her mind....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Final Council
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Final Council</u> \qGlorfindel, mightiest of Elf-lords, tests the heart of Narmeleth, seeking to learn if the spirit of Amarthiel has truly passed from her. If Narmeleth has indeed returned, her knowledge of Angmar may aid the Free Peoples in overthrowing the False King....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: We Cannot Get Out
privateEncounter.description: <u>We Cannot Get Out</u> \qAlas that Balin son of Fundin believed he could reclaim Moria with but a small force. As the Company of the Ring learned, the numbers of the Orcs and the might of Durin's Bane could not easily be turned aside....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Battle of the Twenty-first Hall
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle of the Twenty-first Hall</u> \qIn the aftermath of the raid upon Zabadgathol, Mazog sets his strength against Durin's Folk, assaulting many key encampments. If the Twenty-first Hall falls, then the advantage falls to Mazog's Orcs.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Battle of the Deepway
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle of the Deep-way</u> \qBori's failed raid upon Zabadgathol has brought the wrath of the Orcs down upon the dwarves. The encampment at the Deep-way faces a terrible onslaught from Mazog's horde. Are the Longbeards strong enough to face the challenge?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Battle of the Smithway
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle of the Way of Smiths</u> \qWith the revelation of Zigilburk, Mazog knows that the Heart of Fire has been discovered and seeks to claim the forge for his own. In the Way of Smiths, the dwarves must stem the flood of darkness and prevent the Heart of Fire from falling to the Orcs.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Drowned Treasury
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Drowned Treasury</u> \qIn the flooded depths of Moria was the great axe Zigilburk lost. Few have ever tried to find it, and fewer ever returned from their quests. Who now remains to challenge the shadows that linger in the dark halls of the deep places...?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Mazog
privateEncounter.description: <u>Mazog</u> \qPride oft heralds woe, it is said. With the power of the mithril axe Zigilburk at hand, will pride overthrow the dwarves who seek to reclaim Moria, or will it fuel the fire that burns within them to drive forth Mazog from Zabadgathol at last?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Mirror of Galadriel
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Mirror of Galadriel</u> \qJealously do I guard my secrets, not the least of which is my mirror. Still there are times which require a greater knowledge, and this is one such time. Shadows gather in the east, and the fates of lost friends burns in the heart....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: An Eye in the Storm
privateEncounter.description: <u>An Eye in the Storm</u> \qThe view from Weathertop is wide, and many have climbed that great hill to see all that could be seen. You have been brought hither to learn of the subtle influences connecting runes with nature, for words and speech-craft hold much sway over many powers in Middle-earth.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Word of a Healer
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Word of a Healer</u> \qThe Dourhands have long scouted the lands near the dwarf-keep Othrikar, and they now move to attack the outpost of our friends. The good sentries of Othrikar are stout warriors, but they will be outnumbered, and their victory over the Dourhand menace is far from being assured by the odds as they stand.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Spear at the Southern March
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Spear at the Southern March</u> \qBrigands and half-orcs from the south have been pressing upon the Greenway as of late, threatening the good folk of Bree-town. You have been enlisted to join the line of Wardens who march against these foes, for brigands possess a chaotic nature, and will not stand against such organized defence.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Defence in the Darkness
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Defence in the Darkness</u> \qIn the woods near Lin Giliath, a broken refuge of the Elves, Stone-trolls have gotten the better of a small host who marched to the defence of their haven. Their fate stands upon a precarious edge, but your arrival has brought them hope when their doom was nigh.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Mysterious Council
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Mysterious Council</u> \qThe flame from the scorched breath of a pygmy drake gave life to your torch, and a map was revealed to guide your feet to this chamber. Moria has many forgotten places, hidden by secrets that died with their keepers. What will your bright light illuminate now that the darkness is pierced?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Flame and Shadow
privateEncounter.description: <u>Flame and Shadow</u> \qRemarkable darkness and a long-forgotten cavern live out the years in silent stillness, and will soon be disturbed at last by the inimitable torch you now bear. Your instructions now bid you to seek an extraordinary flame to set this great beacon alight.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Bult-kâr
privateEncounter.description: <u>Bult-kâr</u> \qOnce one of the great lumber storehouses of Moria, Bult-kâr has long since fallen into the domain of Orc and beast. The Iron Garrison, in need of supplies to fuel their reclamation efforts, see Bult-kâr as a crucial location that must be brought back into the control of the dwarves.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Sejer-tharâkh
privateEncounter.description: <u>Sejer-tharâkh</u> \qA lumber storehouse of repute, Sejer-tharâkh was also known to hold one of the greatest libraries of trade-records in all of Moria. The Iron Garrison seeks to reclaim the lost trade-records and use that information to aid them in re-establishing Khazad-dûm as a great merchant kingdom.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Mekeb-faham
privateEncounter.description: <u>Mekeb-faham</u> \qThe Dwarves of Moria had a rich history. Their scholars worked diligently transcribing plans, tactics, and epic stories to parchment so that they might remember the past.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Mekeb-farak
privateEncounter.description: <u>Mekeb-farak</u> \qWhen Moria fell, so too did its lore and legends. Within the halls of Mekeb-farak, the stories told by the Dwarves of Moria rest silent and dust covered, waiting for someone to find them.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Tumun-ghâr
privateEncounter.description: <u>Tumun-ghâr</u> \qWith lessons newly learned, the Iron Garrison cautiously seeks a local supply of ore within Moria to supplement their caravans. Within the Redhorn Lodes, out of the sight of the Orcs, they have discovered Tumun-ghâr. With high hopes, they delve into this long abandoned mine, being always cautious not to delve too deep.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Fulz-zahar
privateEncounter.description: <u>Fulz-zahar</u> \qNow established in the Twenty-first Hall, the Iron Garrison has dispatched scouts to the Redhorn Lodes in search of new sources of ore. In a small cleft along the region's southern borders, they have discovered Fulz-zahar -- a small mine upon which many big hopes lie.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Mirror-halls of Lumul-nar
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Mirror-halls of Lumul-nar</u> \qTo bring life back to the gardens of Moria, the Iron Garrison has crafted great mirrors and placed them upon the pinnacle of Zirakzigil. The light has failed, however, and the dwarves seek to learn why their mirrors do not reflect it as they once did.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Water Wheels - Nalâ-dûm
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Water Wheels: Nalâ-dûm</u> \qDeep in the abysses of Moria, the dwarves had once crafted a great waterway to bring water in from the mountains. Something now blocks the great wheels from turning, causing the Iron Garrison concern.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Filikul
privateEncounter.description: <u>Filikul</u> \qHasta went forth to discover the meaning of the strange happenings which occurred but weeks before. He has not returned, and his companions are becoming worried that something may have happened to him...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Sons of Leaf and Stone
privateEncounter.description: <u>Sons of Leaf and Stone</u> \qThough the memory be now dim, of old Elves and dwarves were close in friendship. Legolas of Mirkwood and Gimli the dwarf, through shared hardship, have rekindled the old bonds. Even now they look for Orcs to slay beneath the eaves of Lothlórien.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Lost Workshop
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Lost Workshop</u> \qThe workshop of Melkólf Stonecarver may hold the key to freeing the dwarf Bori from the clutches of Mazog. There is rumour of a secret escape passage from the throne room of Durin, and knowledge of it may be found amid Melkólf's possessions.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Secret Road
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Secret Road</u> \qThe secret way out of the throne room of Durin was known to a few only, all of whom perished during the fall of the great dwarf-kingdom. But the errant mark of a forgotten scribe preserved a record of its existence, and now it may be used to rescue the dwarf Bori from the clutches of the Orcs.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Worries of Lord Celeborn
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Worries of Lord Celeborn</u> \qThe defeat of Mazog has sent ripples of hope throughout the dwarves of the Iron Garrison; though it be short-lived, my husband Celeborn must be satisfied with that victory and turn his eyes towards other dangers on the horizon.\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Garden Cave
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Garden Cave

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Battle of Lórien
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle of Lórien</u> \qThe Orcs of Moria have come down from the mountains, and as they launch their attack on Lothlórien, Elf and Elf-friend alike must stand against them, or perish...\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Hedge Maze
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Hedge Maze

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Sword-hall of Dol Guldur
privateEncounter.description: <u>Sword-hall of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Sword-hall of Dol Guldur in the central training hall of the Enemy's minions, overseen by three terrible champions of the Dark Lord....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Sammath Gûl
privateEncounter.description: <u>Sammath Gûl</u> \qSammath Gul are the chambers once occupied by the Dark Lord Sauron in the guise of the Necromancer of Mirkwood. Stained by his presence, few now dare enter here...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Dungeons of Dol Guldur
privateEncounter.description: <u>Dungeons of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Dungeons of Dol Guldur are famed for their terror. Thrain, father of Thorin Oakenshield, perished here... though not before passing his legacy to Gandalf the Grey....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Warg-pens of Dol Guldur
privateEncounter.description: <u>Warg-pens of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Warg-pens of Dol Guldur are where the hounds of the Dark Lord are bred, trained, and kept. Here, goblin-keepers care for the matron of the pack....\q

privateEncounter.name: Raid: Barad Guldur
privateEncounter.description: <u>Barad Guldur</u> \qBarad Guldur is the chief tower of Dol Guldur. From here, the Necromancer once viewed Greenwood the Great. Now the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur forays from this perch in search of the Company of the Ring....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Siege of Gondamon
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Siege of Gondamon</u> \qThe Dourhands have forged an alliance with the Blue Crag goblins and have laid siege to Gondamon for nearly two weeks. The final assault will be launched soon....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Trouble in Tuckborough
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Trouble in Tuckborough</u> \qBrigands and goblins are laying siege to the Great Smials. Food supplies are low, and time is running short....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Starlight and Shadows
privateEncounter.description: <u>Starlight & Shadow</u> \qTurning Elvish relics to dark purposes, an evil sorcerer prepares to summon deadly shadows from the Void atop an ancient tower over Emyn Lûm.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Escape from Rushdurinul
privateEncounter.description: <u>Escape from Rushdurinul</u> \qIssuriel listened to the tale of your adventure along the Secret Road into Rushdurinul, where the Orc-king Mazog was seized by the dwarves... but there was more to the story, and now she waits for you to tell it.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Return to Azanarukâr
privateEncounter.description: <u>Return to Azanarukâr</u> \qIn the depths of Azanarukâr, the sorceries of Gorothúl have set into motion an evil that cannot be ignored. You have come with Magor into the dark reaches, and must end this threat before it is too late.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Narrow Way
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Narrow Way</u> \qA brave Elf-scout finds herself trapped behind enemy lines in the darkness of Taur Morvith. There is naught but a single narrow bridge to offer hope of escape.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Ford of Bruinen
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Ford of Bruinen</u> \qThe forces of evil have marched up to the bank of the Bruinen and waited for the sign to attack. Dark clouds roll in as a great storm approaches. If the Ford falls, Rivendell shall not be far behind it. The battle is nearly upon you....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: A Cornered Foe
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Cornered Foe</u> \qGollum has been cornered by a cunning Orc-commander from Dol Guldur. Should he be captured, his knowledge of the Ring and the Company entrusted with it will be laid bare to the Enemy.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Stand at Amon Sûl
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Stand at Amon Sûl</u> \qNot long ago a great battle was fought upon the peak of Weathertop between Gandalf the Grey and the Nine. Evil has been drawn to Amon Sûl, where the Ranger Candaith seeks to hold the hill for the Rangers of the North....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Plans of the Golden Host
privateEncounter.description: <u>Plans of the Golden Host</u> \qThe Golden Host of Lothlórien has crossed the river Anduin, but now a second, smaller party must follow in its wake. These are the Elves of the Hidden Guard, chosen to bring the prisoner Mazog to the gates of Dol Guldur.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Exchange
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Exchange</u> \qTensions run high among the remaining Elves of the Hidden Guard: one of their number slain, the other dying from a deadly poison. And now the dwarf Bróin has disappeared on the eve of the journey's end…\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Mazog in the Web
privateEncounter.description: <u>Mazog in the Web</u> \qNow the Hidden Guard must brave the dangerous woods and canyons of the Scuttledells, home to the Saewethil, a brood of venomous spiders that will brook no intrusion…\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Midnight in the Drownholt
privateEncounter.description: <u>Midnight in the Drownholt</u> \qThe first leg of the Hidden Guard's journey will take them through the treacherous fens of the Drownholt, a perilous road but a necessary one when secrecy is so highly prized.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Strike Against Dannenglor
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Strike Against Dannenglor</u> \qHere at Dannenglor, the Enemy holds and interrogates those they have captured in battle. The prisoners must be rescued swiftly!\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Breaching the Necromancer's Gate
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Breaching the Necromancer's Gate</u> \qDol Guldur is a labyrinth of tight hallways and open courtyards. The Necromancer's Gate marks the entry into the heart of the fortress....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Protectors of Thangúlhad
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Protectors of Thangúlhad</u> \qWhat was once an important fortification of the Enemy is now held by a small band of Elves. Unfortunately, the Enemy is marching there in force. Fortunately, some of the ballistae and catapults still function....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Assault on the Ringwraiths' Lair
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Assault on the Ringwraiths' Lair</u> \qThe baileys of Dol Guldur are highly fortified, nearly impenetrable, and the finest of the Enemy's soldiers defend within. But before the rest of the fortress can be assaulted, these must be taken....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Battle in the Tower
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle in the Tower</u> \qThe time has come for the last assault upon the fortress of Dol Guldur. The fighting begins even as a smaller force enters the citadel in secret, prepared to face their final foe....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Memories of Mithrandir
privateEncounter.description: <u>Memories of Mithrandir</u> \qDimly-remembered stories from his childhood, oft-repeated in the darkness of his cell, have struck the spark of memory in Bori the dwarf. He is certain the passage you discovered is the same used by Mithrandir long ago to enter Dol Guldur in secret.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Zigilburk Returned
privateEncounter.description: <u>Zigilburk Returned</u> \qThe dwarves Bori and Bróin have arrived at a momentous decision: to return the mithril axe, Zigilburk, to the place where it was found, never to be wielded by friend or foe again.\q

privateEncounter.name: Solo Instance: Retake Weathertop
privateEncounter.description: <u>Retake Weathertop</u> \qWeathertop... once a watchtower of the Dúnedain, now a refuge for Orcs. Candaith the Ranger strives to break their foothold in the Weather Hills....\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Mirkwood Landing
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Mirkwood Landing

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Thievery and Mischief
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Thievery and Mischief</u> \qWhile war raged in the South and the Rangers of the North were absent, brigands and ruffians took an opportunity to steal control of Bree....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Defence of The Prancing Pony
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Defence of The Prancing Pony</u> \qThe inhabitants of Bree have spent the occupation holed up within The Prancing Pony. Angered at their uprising, the brigands have decided to burn them out....\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Thorin's Hall Arena
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Thorin's Hall Arena

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Defence of The Prancing Pony
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Defence of The Prancing Pony</u> \qThe inhabitants of Bree have spent the occupation holed up within The Prancing Pony. Angered at their uprising, the brigands have decided to burn them out....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Thievery and Mischief
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Thievery and Mischief</u> \qWhile war raged in the South and the Rangers of the North were absent, brigands and ruffians took an opportunity to wrest control of Bree....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Hilltop Assault
privateEncounter.description: <u>Hilltop Assault</u> \qThe Golden Host is preparing to bring the first act of their invasion on Mirkwood to a close with an all-out assault upon the hill overlooking the landing.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Dungeons of Dol Guldur
privateEncounter.description: <u>Dungeons of Dol Guldur</u> \qA small force of Elves has infiltrated the dungeons of Dol Guldur under cover of darkness, aiming to find and release the dwarf Bori from the bonds of his captivity.\q

privateEncounter.name: Solo Instance: Red-pass
privateEncounter.description: <u>Red-pass</u> \qThe Gaunt-lord Ivar spreads corruption through Agamaur, the Red Swamp, raising a host of evil to do the bidding of Angmar....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Garth Agarwen Barrows
privateEncounter.description: <u>Garth Agarwen - Barrows</u> \qAt the height of their kingdom, the Men of Rhudaur enshrined their dead within great tombs of stone and built into the ground. At the crest of the tallest barrow, Ivar the Blood-hand, awaits any who would attempt to cleanse the corruption from the land and free the Red-maid from her service to the Darkness.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Garth Agarwen Arboretum
privateEncounter.description: <u>Garth Agarwen - Arboretum</u> \qOnce a lush garden the Arboretum's caretaker, Grimbark, was driven mad when the Red-maid fell to corruption. Now, Grimbark forces all vestige of uncorrupted life from the Arboretum making it a welcome home for The Dead.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Survival: Barrow-downs
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Survival: Barrow-downs</u> \qThose who have long haunted the Barrow-downs at the command of the Witch-King are angered by your intrusion. Surviving is the least of your newfound concerns....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Death From Below
privateEncounter.description: <u>Death From Below</u> \qBeneath the captured tower of Thangúlhad, the earth stirs as a band of goblins strives to undermine the Malledhrim outpost.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Challenge at the Gate
Instance: Messages from Lórien
privateEncounter.description: <u>Messages from Lórien</u> \qMessages have come from Lothlórien, messages that cannot be ignored. My sons have returned from the Wild, and together they and a hero of Eriador must respond to these tidings with decisive action...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Farewell to Evendim
privateEncounter.description: <u>Farewell to Evendim</u> \qThe Ranger Calenglad has long stood watch over the ancient city of Annúminas, in Evendim. If he is to join the Grey Company on its southern road, he will need to leave that city behind...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Lothrandir of the Frozen Wastes
privateEncounter.description: <u>Lothrandir of the Frozen Wastes</u> \qThe Ranger Lothrandir has knowledge of the southern lands through which the Grey Company must pass, but he will only take that road once he is certain the Lossoth of Forochel are free of danger...\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Rescue in Nûrz Ghâshu
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Rescue in Nûrz Ghâshu</u> \qTaken by some madness, Golodir has ventured into the Rift. The air is thick with menace, and the stench of Thaurlach lingers....\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Festival Garden
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Festival Garden

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Grey King
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Grey King</u> \qThe terrible beast known in legend as the Grey King has long haunted the passes of the Gloomglens, waiting in secret to throw boulders down upon the heads of the unwary.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Guiding the Misguided
privateEncounter.description: <u>Guiding the Misguided</u> \qGwin Curhonon, a hobbit of the Gloomglens, was captured by the bugan, wild goblins owing allegiance to no one. Now he seeks the help of a brave hero to bring him to safety.\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Laenan Caves
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Laenan Caves

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Tham Úmdúr
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Tham Úmdúr

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: A Timely Rescue
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Timely Rescue</u> \qNow and again even the finest tracker may find that the tables have turned upon him and the hunter becomes the hunted. So it is with my kinsman Amarion, who finds himself in a precarious position, as shadow wolves stalk him in the gathering darkness.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Behind Bars
privateEncounter.description: <u>Behind Bars</u> \qNot long ago, my kinsman Dagoras was captured by deserters from the Dunlending force in Eregion. I've sent aid for his rescue, but their freedom shall be short-lived if they cannot escape before the alarm is raised.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Ost Elendil
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Ost Elendil</u> \qThe Black Númenóreans in league with Amarthiel have come to Ost Elendil, seeking to establish a foothold in Annúminas, while the Rangers of the North assail the city of their fathers in a desperate attempt to drive them forth.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Glinghant
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Glinghant</u> \qGlinghant, the gardens of Annúminas -- once a place of great beauty, now overgrown and fallen into ruin. The stagnant waters of the gardens have become corrupted by the fell spirits of Angmar, and evil Men do their bidding....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Haudh Valandil
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Haudh Valandil</u> \qThe Lords of Umbar, sorcerers trained by Sauron, the great Necromancer, seek to bring terror to Annúminas by raising the long-dead remains of Valandil, third King of Arnor, as a terrible wight. Only the most courageous of the Free Peoples will be able to put an end to their evil deeds....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Rise of the Fallen Son
privateEncounter.description: <u>Rise of the Fallen Son</u> \qThe shades of a Dunlending clan stir restlessly amid the barrows of the Lich Bluffs. What broken oath binds these poor spirits to the confines of this world? Perhaps the shade of one of their heroes holds the answer….\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Old Woman of the Mountain
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Old Woman of the Mountain</u> \qGwyllion, the Old Woman of the Mountain, in service to Saruman the White has brought terror to the herdsmen of the Uch-lûth. Saeradan now seeks to bring her reign of terror to an end.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: School at Tham Mírdain
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The School at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe School at Tham Mírdain was once a pinnacle of learning during the age of the Noldor, but it has now fallen into disrepair and is overrun by the minions of Saruman, who seeks greater knowledge of the Rings of Power.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Library at Tham Mírdain
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Library at Tham Mírdain</u> \qThe Library at Tham Mírdain once held much of the knowledge of the early Ages and withstood the brunt of Sauron's attack against Eregion. Though much of the surviving lore was carried away by Elrond Halfelven, the forces of Angmar now seek the remnants....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Spider Wing
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Helegrod</u> \qHelegrod... Once a dwarf-hold in the Misty Mountains, until the coming of a great dragon. Though the dragon has long since perished, and the ice of many long winters has engulfed the ruins, rumours out of the North speak of a terrible shadow returning to the frozen halls....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Giant Wing
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Helegrod</u> \qHelegrod... Once a dwarf-hold in the Misty Mountains, until the coming of a great dragon. Though the dragon has long since perished, and the ice of many long winters has engulfed the ruins, rumours out of the North speak of a terrible shadow returning to the frozen halls....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Dragon Wing
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Helegrod</u> \qHelegrod... Once a dwarf-hold in the Misty Mountains, until the coming of a great dragon. Though the dragon has long since perished, and the ice of many long winters has engulfed the ruins, rumours out of the North speak of a terrible shadow returning to the frozen halls....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Drake Wing
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Helegrod</u> \qHelegrod... Once a dwarf-hold in the Misty Mountains, until the coming of a great dragon. Though the dragon has long since perished, and the ice of many long winters has engulfed the ruins, rumours out of the North speak of a terrible shadow returning to the frozen halls....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: As Near As May Be
privateEncounter.description: <u>As Near As May Be</u> \qA skilled jewel-crafter has crossed our path, and Halbarad has devised a curious plan for him. He wants imitations made of the ring of Barahir borne by Aragorn for each Dúnadan in our company...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The House of Isildur
privateEncounter.description: <u>The House of Isildur</u> \qIn the year 1975 of the Third Age, a party of Dúnedain led by the brothers Laegened and Haerdor travelled north into Forochel to reclaim the relics left behind in the flight from the wreck of Fornost...\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Delotham
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Delotham

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Minas Elendúr
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Minas Elendúr

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Urugarth
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Urugarth</u> \qLying on the outskirts of Carn Dûm is the fortress of Urugarth, home to countless Orcs, goblins, and other curs of Angmar... The breeding grounds of Angmar's horde.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Carn Dûm
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Carn Dûm</u> \qCarn Dûm, the capital of Angmar and the former stronghold of the Witch-king. Angmar's shadow has returned to this city in the form of the False King, Mordirith, Steward of Angmar.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Barad Gúlaran
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Barad Gúlaran</u> \qHaving obtained all the tools they need to contain a terrible spell, the sorcerers of Angmar retreat to Barad Gúlaran to fulfil the commands of their mistress Amarthiel, while the Rangers of the North seek to hinder them....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Goblin-town Throne Room
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Goblin-town Throne Room</u> \qIn the darkest depths of Goblin-town, at the heart of the goblin kingdom, teeming with the vile breed, lay the throne room of the Great Goblin. Long have the inhabitants of Goblin-town been leaderless, but as the Shadow in the East grows, calling its minions to arms, a new leader has taken the mantle of the Great Goblin....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Fortress
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Garth Agarwen</u> \qGarth Agarwen . . . The ruins of an ancient fortress of Rhudaur, now overrun by corrupted nature and a vile necromantic power out of Angmar. The most terrible power still remains to be confronted.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Barrows
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Garth Agarwen - Barrows</u> \qAt the height of their kingdom, the Men of Rhudaur enshrined their dead within great tombs of stone and built into the ground. At the crest of the tallest barrow, Ivar the Blood-hand, awaits any who would attempt to cleanse the corruption from the land and free the Red-maid from her service to the Darkness.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Arboretum
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Garth Agarwen - Arboretum</u> \qOnce a lush garden the Arboretum's caretaker, Grimbark, was driven mad when the Red-maid fell to corruption. Now, Grimbark forces all vestige of uncorrupted life from the Arboretum making it a welcome home for The Dead.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: North-downs: Fornost
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu</u> \qWithin the Rift of Nûrz Ghâshu, Angmar mines for the ore they need to arm their legions. In their search for iron, they have uncovered the home of the Eldgang, as well as a hidden evil, ancient beyond knowledge....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Trail Ends
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Trail Ends</u> \qThe Draig-lûth has captured many clansmen and women of the Uch-lûth and imprisoned them in a great cavern hidden behind a waterfall. It is the fate of these poor prisoners to be used as fodder to appease the gwiber and giants of Thrór's Coomb....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Thanes' Council
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Brenin's Council</u> \qThe Brenin's Council of Lhanuch gathers even now, to decide whether to join their bretheren to the south in allegiance to Isengard. But they are a proud isolated people who will not bend easily, even when threatened with the power of the traitor Saruman.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Father of Our Lament
privateEncounter.description: <u>Father of our Lament</u> \qThe oath of Fernvael, father of Cadelhin, binds the shades of the Lich Bluffs to their earthly tombs. The only hope remaining for these poor spirits is the defeat of their dark ruler….\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Water Wheels: Nalâ-dûm
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Water Wheels: Nalâ-dûm</u> \qDeep in the abysses of Moria, the dwarves had once crafted a great waterway to bring water in from the mountains. Something now blocks the great wheels from turning, causing the Iron Garrison concern.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Fil Gashan
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Fil Gashan</u> \qFil Ghashan is the stronghold of Talug, right hand of Mazog, Lord of Moria. Here, the Orc-general musters an army to make a futile assault upon Lothlórien. Here, he also breeds Orc-warriors of a most deadly skill....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Skûmfil
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Skûmfil</u> \qSince the overthrow of Moria, the Orcs have disposed of their dead in the great chasm they call Skûmfil. Over the ages, the rotting pile of carcasses and filth that has accumulated there has also attracted many foul and disgusting creatures, from the vile Gredbyg to the scavenging Kergrim....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Sixteenth Hall
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Sixteenth Hall</u> \qThe dread malady that spreads among the servants of the Enemy in Moria is strong in the Sixteenth Hall. Whatever nameless thing dwells there has entrapped many an Orc to its service, poisoning their minds and controlling their actions.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Warg-pens of Dol Guldur
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Warg-pens of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Warg-pens of Dol Guldur are where the hounds of the Dark Lord are bred, trained, and kept. Here, goblin-keepers care for the matron of the pack...\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Forges of Khazad-dûm
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Forges of Khazad-dûm</u> \qAt the height of Durin's reign, the Forges of Khazad-dûm were once famed for producing great crafts of beauty and majesty. Now they have fallen into misuse by the Orcs which now infest the ancient halls of Moria, spewing forth their terrible tools of war....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Dâr Narbugud
