skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Dâr Narbugud</u> \qThe Elves of Lórien have uncovered Dâr Narbugud, the lair of the Mistress of Pestilence, the vile creature responsible for the plague spreading among the creatures of Moria. What heroes will overthrow the queen of the nameless? Who will put an end to her plague?\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Filikul
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Filikul</u> \qHasta went forth to discover the meaning of the strange happenings which occurred but weeks before. He has not returned, and his companions are becoming worried that something may have happened to him...\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Sword-hall of Dol Guldur
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Sword-hall of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Sword-hall of Dol Guldur is the central training hall of the Enemy's minions, overseen by three terrible champions of the Dark Lord...\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Forgotten Treasury
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Forgotten Treasury</u> \qMany ancient halls lie hidden beneath ages of ruin within the walls of Moria. The dwarves seek to recover and protect their treasures of old, while the Orcs seek to exploit them. Soon, the Forgotten Treasury may become a battleground of terrible proportions....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Vile Maw
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Vile Maw</u> \qWhither did the Watcher in the Water flee when it was driven from its lake? The Vile Maw would be my guess. Beneath the waters of the dark flood are ways which lead into the black depths of Moria....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Dungeons of Dol Guldur
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Dungeons of Dol Guldur</u> \qThe Dungeons of Dol Guldur are famed for their terror. Thrain, father of Thorin Oakenshield, perished here...though not before passing his legacy to Gandalf the Grey...\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Sammath Gûl
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Sammath Gûl</u> \qSammath Gûl are the chambers once occupied by the Dark Lord Sauron in the guise of the Necromancer of Mirkwood. Stained by his presence, few now dare enter here...\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Mirror-halls of Lumul-nar
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Mirror-halls of Lumul-nar</u> \qTo bring life back to the gardens of Moria, the Iron Garrison has crafted great mirrors and placed them upon the pinnacle of Zirakzigil. The light has failed, however, and the dwarves seek to learn why their mirrors do not reflect it as they once did.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Dark Delvings
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Dark Delvings</u> \qIn the deepest delvings of Moria dwell nameless things which shun the light and feed on the darkness. The Elves of Lórien strive to constrain the vile creatures, but led by the evil Gurvand, they may be too strong to hold back forever....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Barad Guldur
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Barad Guldur</u> \qBarad Guldur is the chief tower of Dol Guldur. From here, the Necromancer once viewed Greenwood the Great. Now the Lieutenant of Dol Guldur forays from this perch in search of the Company of the Ring...\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Halls of Crafting
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Halls of Crafting</u> \qThere were no greater craftsmen than the Dwarves of Khazad-dûm. Those days are now gone, and Mazog's Orcs, with the aid of Black Uruks from Dol Guldur, have taken the ancient crafting halls of Moria to forge their vile weapons of war.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Grand Stair
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Grand Stair</u> \qIn elder days, this place once served as a grand portal to many levels and halls within Moria, but since the ruin of Moria, it has become a den of many Orc-tribes. Mazog, he who rules the Orcs of Moria, exacts his tribute here through his minion Igash....\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Ancient Oxen
privateEncounter.description: <u>Ancient Spirits</u> \qA great power of old lies hidden within the Mournshaws of Enedwaith, and spirits that once wandered the ancient world now roam these woods. Only by confronting these spirits will favour be garnered in the court of the Huntsman.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Ancient Boar
privateEncounter.description: <u>Ancient Spirits</u> \qA great power of old lies hidden within the Mournshaws of Enedwaith, and spirits that once wandered the ancient world now roam these woods. Only by confronting these spirits will favour be garnered in the court of the Huntsman.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Ancient Stag
privateEncounter.description: <u>Ancient Spirits</u> \qA great power of old lies hidden within the Mournshaws of Enedwaith, and spirits that once wandered the ancient world now roam these woods. Only by confronting these spirits will favour be garnered in the court of the Huntsman.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Ancient Falcon
privateEncounter.description: <u>Ancient Spirits</u> \qA great power of old lies hidden within the Mournshaws of Enedwaith, and spirits that once wandered the ancient world now roam these woods. Only by confronting these spirits will favour be garnered in the court of the Huntsman.\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Area Instance
privateEncounter.description: Public Area Instance

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Thadúr
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Othrongroth</u> \qOthrongroth, the Great Barrow, the oldest and largest of the Edain mounds within the Barrow-downs... And home to some of the most terrifying servants of the Witch-king.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Sambrog
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Othrongroth</u> \qOthrongroth, the Great Barrow, the oldest and largest of the Edain mounds within the Barrow-downs... And home to some of the most terrifying servants of the Witch-king.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Maze
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Othrongroth</u> \qOthrongroth, the Great Barrow, the oldest and largest of the Edain mounds within the Barrow-downs... And home to some of the most terrifying servants of the Witch-king.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Summoning Chamber
privateEncounter.description: <u>Darkness Revealed</u> \qNot only the shades of Oathbreakers wander the barrows of the Lich Bluff. Some dark Power has raised a horde of wights in service to the enemy. Only by travelling into the darkest recesses of an ancient barrow can the source of this evil be uncovered….\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: An Echo of Days Past
privateEncounter.description: <u>An Echo of Days Past</u> \qWhile Frithgeir prepares the brew that will restore the sense of our host, an ancient dwarf who has lived long and seen much, our company decides what should next be done...\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Haunted Burrow
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Haunted Burrow

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Ost Dunhoth
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Ost Dunhoth</u> \qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition...\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Battle of the Deep-way
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle of the Deep-way</u> \qBori's failed raid upon Zabadgathol has brought the wrath of the Orcs down upon the dwarves. The encampment at the Deep-way faces a terrible onslaught from Mazog's horde. Are the Longbeards strong enough to face the challenge?\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Sâri-surma
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Sâri-surma</u> \qAn evil presence has descended upon the Ice Bay of Forochel, inhabiting a large glacial iceberg. Having sent several hunters to defeat the evil, the Lossoth have asked you to help them destroy this evil once and for all....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Lost Temple
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Lost Temple</u> \qA band of mercenaries led by the Gaunt-lord Ferndúr have begun looting a hidden Rhudauran temple, left in ruin since the fall of the Northern Kingdoms. What purpose does this servant of darkness have within?\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Northcotton Farm
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Northcotton Farm</u> \qSeveral hobbits have disappeared recently in the vicinity of the Northcotton Farm. It was abandoned years ago, but something stirs within its grounds and a faint, sweet aroma wafts over the walls....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Battle of the Way of Smiths
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle of the Way of Smiths</u> \qWith the revelation of Zigilburk, Mazog knows that the Heart of Fire has been discovered and seeks to claim the forge for his own. In the Way of Smiths, the dwarves must stem the flood of darkness and prevent the Heart of Fire from falling to the Orcs.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Battle of the Twenty-first Hall
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle of the Twenty-first Hall</u> \qIn the aftermath of the raid upon Zabadgathol, Mazog sets his strength against Durin's Folk, assaulting many key encampments. If the Twenty-first Hall falls, then the advantage falls to Mazog's Orcs.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Halls of Night
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Halls of Night</u> \qThe Hillmen of Angmar have discovered an ancient barrow hidden away for centuries. The leaders of Aughaire have called for adventurers willing to brave the tomb rumoured to be filled with wealth and riches. Markings surrounding its entrance bear an ominous warning; twisted creatures and slumbering warriors at the foot of a powerful sorcerer…\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Stoneheight
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Stoneheight</u> \qStoneheight was once a place of refuge from the Orc-tribes in the North Downs, but now their walls have been breached. Yet even as the houses burn and crumble to the ground, you notice that it was not Orcs alone that did this.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Draigoch's Lair
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Draigoch's Lair</u> \qWelcome, Thieves. I can smell the dread in your sweat. I hear the whistle of fear in your breath and feel the fluttering of your little hearts as they race in your chests. But come now, why do you fear? There is plenty of treasure here...enough for all, and more to spare.\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Winter Festival
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Winter Festival

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Inn of the Forsaken
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Inn of the Forsaken</u> \qYou have been asked by the proprietor of the Forsaken Inn to investigate the source of a terrible wailing noise coming from the basement. Rumours abound that the inn is haunted and as a result, business has been suffering.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: At the Stone of Erech
privateEncounter.description: <u>At the Stone of Erech</u> \qIn the Second Age of Middle-earth, Isildur called the Men of the Mountains to the hill of Erech to discuss their loyalties....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Ergothorn Elf-friend
privateEncounter.description: <u>Lhaid Ogo</u> \qCan the words of Ergothorn be trusted? If so, a messenger from Dunland must be somewhere in the depths of Lhaid Ogo, hurt and afraid...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Attack on Zudrugund
privateEncounter.description: <u>Attack on Zudrugund</u> \qOnce more we put our trust in Ergothorn and travel with utmost haste to Zudrugund. Will we find there a band of uruks, as he says, or a time-wasting detour?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Echoes of the Dead
privateEncounter.description: <u>Echoes of the Dead</u> \qWe have come to walk the Forsaken Road, where a group of Oathbreakers sought to escape their curse. Is it possible that Aragorn might compel them to fulfill their oath? We seek to learn if it is so.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Mirror-halls of Lumul-nar
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Mirror-halls of Lumul-nar</u> \qTo bring life back to the gardens of Moria, the Iron Garrison has crafted great mirrors and placed them upon the pinnacle of Zirakzigil. The light has failed, however, and the dwarves seek to learn why their mirrors do not reflect it as they once did.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Water Wheels - Nalâ-dûm
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Water Wheels: Nalâ-dûm</u> \qDeep in the abysses of Moria, the dwarves had once crafted a great waterway to bring water in from the mountains. Something now blocks the great wheels from turning, causing the Iron Garrison concern.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Icy Crevasse
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Icy Crevasse</u> \qA powerful sorceror from Angmar seeks to drive the frozen winds of Forochel south into Evendim, freezing the lake and allowing a great army to march on Tinnudir....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Passage Into Dunland
privateEncounter.description: <u>Passage Into Dunland</u> \qYou have been invited to join a band of Dunlendings as you pass into Trum Dreng.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Imminent Collapse
privateEncounter.description: <u>Imminent Collapse</u> \qOndor the Dwarf seeks to collapse the tunnels from which the Orcs waylay the innocent, avenging the death of his father and sealing the doom of his foes.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Feast of the Running Stag
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Feast of the Running Stag</u> \qElder Riagán has welcomed you to Lhan Tarren and invited you to join in the Feast of the Running Stag, the Stag Clan's annual ritual. You should join your friends at the feast and respectfully observe the rites.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Herald of the Rohirrim
privateEncounter.description: <u>Herald of the Rohirrim</u> \qA brave herald of the Rohirrim has come to stave off battle with the Dunlendings, but one faction is bent upon killing him before he can parley with the brenin of the other clans.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Attack At Dawn
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Attack at Dawn</u> \qIn the late evening hours, a small group of refugees sought refuge in the hidden Ranger-camp of Esteldín. These refugees were followed by a small group of goblin-scouts that quickly fled to Dol Dínen to bring word to their chief, Graug. Siniath the Ranger has asked you to seek out Graug and defeat him before he can spread word of Esteldín's location. As you arrive near Dol Dínen, the first rays of the false dawn can be seen overhead.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Munfaeril's Warning
privateEncounter.description: <u>Munfaeril's Warning</u> \qMadin's grandfather was a good man, giving succour to the People of the Boar when the Draig-lûth nearly destroyed them. Madin and his son Nevid, however, have fallen to evil ways, and I cannot, as a servant of the Huntsman, allow this travesty to continue....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Tribunal of Shadows
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Tribunal of Shadows</u> \qAt last, we have tracked Gwyllion, whom the Dunlendings call the Old Woman of the Mountain, here to the Gravenwood. Whatever foul plot she has put in motion must be stopped at the Slade of Shadows....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Taking a Stand
privateEncounter.description: <u>Taking a Stand</u> \qThéodred's scouts are a brave lot, but I am uncertain that facing the combined might of the Ox-clan and the Dragon-clan is the wisest course of action. Perhaps with a hero's aid, they may indeed stave off the storm blowing south to Rohan....\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Tal Methedras
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Tal Methedras

privateEncounter.name: Dunland: Lhan Colvarn
privateEncounter.description: <u>Ending the Nightmare</u> \qThe Mokúrz-hai have become a plague to the people of the Dunbog. Blaire of the Boar-clan has asked you to accompany him into Lhan Colvarn to end this threat once and for all.\q

privateEncounter.name: Dunland: Wulf's Cleft
privateEncounter.description: <u>Tusks of the Boar</u> \qWhile sailing up-river to deliver crucial information to others who might stand against Isengard, the Boar-clan comes across a great muster of Dunlendings. Rather than stand idly by, they attempt to hinder the army in Wulf's Cleft by destroying their siege-engines.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Will to Stand
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Will to Stand</u> \qWord reached us even in Enedwaith that the Falcon Clan stood against Saruman. But will a common enemy serve to unite us as friends?\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Battle of Dol Baran
privateEncounter.description: <u>Battle of Dol Baran</u> \qThe Dunlending armies unleashed an attack on the Rohirrim holding Dol Baran hoping to dislodge them from the high ground. But the horselords are prepared to defend their position with their lives.\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Beneath Isengard
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Beneath Isengard

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Righting the Wrongs of Trum Dreng
privateEncounter.description: <u>Righting the Wrongs of Trum Dreng</u> \qInfuriated by the attacks orchestrated by the Dragon Clan and seemingly the armies of Isengard as well, Guto plans to take matters into his own hands....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Captive
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Captive</u> \qThe emissary of Isengard captured by the Falcon Clan is near to death. Lheu Brenin hopes to get information from the captive before he passes.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Homestead Defence
privateEncounter.description: <u>Homestead Defence</u> \qMy son awaits at my homestead to provide my messenger the ledger that contains all of my records. I must have this to prepare for the auction in the village.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Fangs of the Wulf
privateEncounter.description: <u>Fangs of the Wulf</u> \qOf all the Ox-clan, I am the most canny, for I know best how to create my own opportunities...a broken sword here, a shattered shield there, and a crippled arm to wield them. Men, arms, and armour do not come cheaply.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Auction
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Auction</u> \qAll is ready for the auction. It is an event not unlike a warrior's arena, for my clan is accustomed to waging war with words and coin...\q

privateEncounter.name: Dunland: Assembly Call
privateEncounter.description: <u>Assembly Call</u> \qThe Avanc-lûth have been swayed by your influence in Dunbog and have called an Assembly. There, they will decide if they are to fight the threat of Isengard or remain secluded from the world.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Missing Persons
privateEncounter.description: <u>Missing Persons</u> \qMany have recently been taken captive by the Dievlig. I fear a grisly fate will befall our allies if they are not found and rescued quickly.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Something Foul
privateEncounter.description: <u>Something Foul</u> \qA great number of Dievlig were seen entering the great cairn in Plas-maru. Perhaps it is here we might discover what causes the Dead to stir in the Bonevales.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Rise and Fall
privateEncounter.description: <u>Rise and Fall</u> \qWith the source of the unrest uncovered, Lhucu prepares to enter Lhan Gogledh and confront her father, Trehéarn. A task she dare not attempt alone.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Forges of Isengard
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Forges of Isengard</u> \qIt would appear that Saruman has been attempting to craft an abundance of Legendary Weapons to fortify the armouries of the White Hand. This forge should be a wealth of useful Legendary components; these will serve the Free Peoples far better than the smiths of Saruman.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: In the Presence of Saruman
privateEncounter.description: <u>In the Presence of Saruman</u> \qThe Old Man wants you. You had better do what he says, if you know what's best for you. Ha! With the power of his voice you won't have a choice!\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Wizard's Vale
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Wizard's Vale</u> \qI was the steward of Saruman's household, and ran his affairs from day to day. I was accorded high honour, and would still were it not for Gríma, the Wormtongue.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Shot in the Dark
privateEncounter.description: <u>Shot in the Dark</u> \qThe Rohirrim are attempting to retake Brôntrig, the Dunlending village that overlooks the Gap of Rohan. If we are successful, we will control two vital outposts to defend against an imminent attack from Wulf's Cleft.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Rescue
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Rescue</u> \qWe will rescue your friends, and we will have vengeance upon the Falcon Clan. You have my word.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Escape from Isengard
privateEncounter.description: <u>Escape from Isengard</u> \qWe do this now or not at all, friend. There is no looking back. We will escape from Isengard or we will die. But we will not stay here.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Odd Benefactors
privateEncounter.description: <u>Odd Benefactors</u> \qThe Dunlendings in Cuvnerth have been receiving supplies from a mysterious source somewhere within a nearby cave. Whatever the foe that aids our enemies, it must be stopped!\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Above Isengard
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Above Isengard

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Revolt in the Deeps
privateEncounter.description: <u>Revolt in the Deeps</u> \qThe Dunlendings and Rohirrim have agreed to put aside their differences and work together in an attempt to escape from their brutal Orc-overseers in the deadly mines hidden beneath the Heathfells.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Gates of Isengard
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Gates of Isengard</u> \qAn emissary of the Rohirrim approaches the gates of Isengard, hoping to learn the true intentions of the wizard Saruman.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Meaning of Alliance
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Meaning of Alliance</u> \qThe people of Galtrev have formed an alliance with the White Hand, for Isengard has vowed friendship in return for assistance in the war effort. But the people left behind in the presence of the servants of Saruman are little more than slaves in this new era....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Defence of Galtrev
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Defence of Galtrev</u> \qThe White Hand was driven out of Galtrev by the Free Peoples, but they return in great numbers with a hunger for revenge. The people of Galtrev must be defended against this evil, for their warriors have been taken from them.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Drowned Relics
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Drowned Relics</u> Many ancient relics are believed to have drowned in the Dunbog, but lucky anglers can often snare these treasures.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Tower of Orthanc
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Tower of Orthanc</u> \qWelcome to the ring of Isengard, heroes. I have watched your progress with great interest. Prove yourselves worthy and I shall share with you the secrets of Middle-earth...\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: Of Axe & Fire
privateEncounter.description: <u>Of Axe & Fire</u> \qThe Uruks of Isengard have come to claim the last remaining trees of Nan Curunir - the grove of Quickbeam the Ent.\ \ Should these dark minions discover the presence of the Ents so close to Isengard, Saruman will bring his fires to bear upon Fangorn before his forces issue forth to face the Rohirrim.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Dargnákh Unleashed
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Dargnákh Unleashed</u> \qA brave band of adventurers...Think you that this drain is long-abandoned? You cannot imagine what lies ahead.\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Winter Festival
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Winter Festival

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Taste of Hobbiton
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Taste of Hobbiton

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Pits of Isengard
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Pits of Isengard</u> \qAhhh, you have found the Pits. What lies beneath is but a small taste of what I shall unleash upon Middle-earth. Man cannot stand against my power, and you too will perish.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Fangorn's Edge
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Fangorn's Edge</u> \qYou have found my lumber-camp. Very impressive. Few know of its existence. Do you think you can stop the tide of progress? The war will continue. The time of Man is over.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Battle of the Ford, Afternoon
privateEncounter.description: <u>Battle of the Ford, Afternoon</u> \qWe formed up between Théodred and our foes, fighting for our lives and his. There seemed to be no end to the uruks!\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Daring Strike, Dawn
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Daring Strike, Dawn</u> \qDawn came swiftly on the twenty-fifth of February, as my Prince prepared to conduct his daring strike.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Daring Strike, Mid-day
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Daring Strike, Mid-day</u> \qThéodred came to the gates of Isengard by mid-day, and the uruks arrayed before him readied for his assault. We lined up, ready to charge!\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Battle of the Ford, Sunset
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle of the Ford, Sunset</u> \qOur prince was trapped in the middle of the river Isen. We had to fight through the line of uruks to reach him!\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Prince of Rohan, Night
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Prince of Rohan, Night</u> \qNight fell on the twenty-fifth of February, as my prince prepared for one last journey, a journey to lands we know not.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Foundry
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Foundry</u> \qI am almost impressed. You have stumbled upon the source of some most unusual weapons. I wonder if you will be able to uncover the real secret that lies within my foundry.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Storm on Methedras
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Storm on Methedras</u> \qWhile the Grey Company journeyed south to the aid of Aragorn, we came upon a Dunlending hag named Gwyllion, called the Old Woman of the Mountain. She sought to raise an army of ancient evil to aid the White Hand against Rohan...it was our duty, Amlan and mine, to keep her at bay....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Troubled Dreams
privateEncounter.description: <u>Troubled Dreams</u> \qYou should get what rest you can, my friend, and try not to dwell upon the horrors of the battle. Perhaps things will seem less grim by the light of day...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Old Friends and New Tidings
privateEncounter.description: <u>Old Friends and New Tidings</u> \qThis Dunlending girl who travels with you cannot be allowed to see the secret ways into Lothlórien. I must bind her eyes if she is to come with you to see the Lady.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Constables and Robbers
privateEncounter.description: <u>Constables and Robbers</u> \qBrigands out of the Brown Lands have established a camp in the Rushgore from which to raid Parth Celebrant for ancient relics. After a diplomatic attempt to remove the brigands from the Rushgore, Aculf prepares to take more drastic measures....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Queen of Queens
privateEncounter.description: <u>Queen of Queens</u> \qWhile dealing with the marsh insects of the Rushgore on behalf of the stranded Woodmen, you discovered the nest of their queen...a discovery that yields unpleasant results.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Wraith of Fire
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Wraith of Shadow
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Wraith of Water
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Wraith of Earth
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Fornost</u> \qFornost, the last capitol of the fallen North Kingdom. It is here that the Witch-king of Angmar crushed the realm of Arnor, and it is here to which Angmar has returned to conquer Eriador.\q

privateEncounter.name: Muckle: Moria
privateEncounter.description: <u>Muckle: Moria</u> \q Within the depths of Moria there is an ancient battle taking place.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Logical Appeal
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Logical Appeal</u> \qAfter seeing the many hardships faced by the Men of Stangard, you and Gadda have decided to make an appeal to the leaders of the settlement.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Show No Fear
privateEncounter.description: <u>Show No Fear</u> \qThe captain of the Easterling scouts in the Rushgore threatens the Woodmen stranded in the marsh, precipitating a confrontation, with the welfare of the merchants hanging in the balance.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Prisoner to Stangard
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Prisoner to Stangard</u> \qYou have taken the Uruk-hai vandal to Stangard, where Gadda has brought him before Stanric and Sithric to await his judgement.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Neighbours Meet
privateEncounter.description: <u>Neighbours Meet</u> \qIt has been many long years since the Men of Rohan established the keep of Stangard on the borders of Lórien, but the neighbouring Elves, suspicious of all, have never yet let themselves be seen by the Rohirrim.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Reasonable Request
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Reasonable Request</u> \qWynmar, struck by the beauty of Noriel, wishes to look upon the Elf one last time before accepting his people's banishment from Thinglad by its Elf-sentinels.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Sunset Storm
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Sunset Storm</u> \qAt the behest of Céola, commander of the Rohirrim border-guard in the Brown Lands, you prepare to make a night-time assault upon Lashkarg, war-camp of the Khundolar...an effort that may be doomed if aid is not found....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Orcs Attack
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Orcs Attack</u> \qWynmar and his men brace for an Orc attack that threatens to be more dire than the earlier encounter on the hill, a mere taste of what is to come….\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Rise of Stangard
privateEncounter.description: <u>Stanric's Stand</u> \qStanric, the leader of Stangard, grows inspired by the changes you have brought about for this crippled settlement.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Rise of Stangard
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Daring Rescue</u> \qSithric, emissary of Théoden, rules in Stanric's place amongst rumours of foul play, and Stangard lies in disarray.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Finding Meneldor
privateEncounter.description: <u>Finding Meneldor</u> \qThe search for the great eagle Meneldor has brought you to a large spider cave in the Wailing Hills, a dwelling most perilous for a denizen of the skies.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Cost of Loyalty
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Cost of Loyalty</u> \qAfter contemplating a vile symbol recovered from brigands, Doron, leader of the Oathbreakers in Parth Celebrant, has chosen to confess how he and his men came to be cursed.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Lights in the Land
privateEncounter.description: <u>Lights in the Land</u> \qEnraged by your assault upon Lashkarg, the Khundolar retaliate against the Rohirrim border-guard, bringing their strength down upon the waypost of Etheburg....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Mists of Anduin
privateEncounter.description: <u>Mists of Anduin</u> \qHas no one seen our new friend...or the Dunlending girl? I thought they would have returned to Stangard by now. Did some trouble befall them on the road?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: An Omen from the East
privateEncounter.description: <u>An Omen from the East</u> \qWhile confronting the treacherous brigands and Oathbreakers of Ost Celebrant, you have discovered a concealed passage that reeks of dread. What horrors could be lurking beneath the crumbling ruins?\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Roots of Fangorn
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Roots of Fangorn</u> \qA dread spider queen, long ago banished beneath the misty mountains, has returned to wreak her vengence upon the ents of the forest. Even now her brood poisons the roots of ancient Fangorn, in caverns far below.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Infiltrators' Surprise
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Infiltrators' Surprise</u> \qAn unsavoury band of the Big Folk have assembled and are planning a frightening surprise for Bree! I hope my new friend can stop them!\q

privateEncounter.name: Muckle: Fangorn
privateEncounter.description: <u>Muckle: Fangorn</u> \q Within the forest of Fangorn there is an ancient battle taking place.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: War Comes to Rohan
privateEncounter.description: <u>War Comes to Rohan</u> \qLanghold is under attack by brigands, and worse yet -- their new Khundolar allies from the East.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Children Approve
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Game of Brigand-bashing</u> \qThe fearless children of Langhold have invited you to join them in a game of Brigand-bashing, in which they re-enact the deeds of their fathers and foes.\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Farms of Sutcrofts
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Farms of Sutcrofts

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Ost Magol
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Ost Magol

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Ghâmpronk
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Ghâmpronk

privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Farms of Norcrofts

privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Creeping Wood

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Siege of Eaworth
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Siege of Eaworth

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Road to Thornhope
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Road to Thornhope

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Sâd Torech
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Sâd Torech

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Haycliff
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Haycliff

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Gerngarth
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Gerngarth

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Defence of Walstow
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Defence of Walstow

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Entwalk
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Entwalk

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Eastern Plains of the Wold
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Eastern Plains of the Wold

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Ford
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Ford

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Defence of Faldham
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Defence of Faldham

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Defence of Harwick
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Defence of Harwick

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Living Deep
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Living Deep

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Langraf
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Langraf

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Dígelon
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Dígelon

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Dwergfant
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Dwergfant

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Facing Fears
privateEncounter.description: <u>Facing Fears</u> \qIngmar, my husband, seeks to persuade his father to allow him to lead a force of men against the Orcs who now threaten us, despite Théoden King's ban. I hope his grandmother, Lady Góda, may bring wisdom to the debate....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Five Against the Wold
privateEncounter.description: <u>Five Against the Wold</u> \qAldor Harding is convinced that he will die to an Easterling blade...it has become our task to prove that men make their own fates. My companions and I will face the blades of the Easterlings, and we will prove victorious!\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Reeve of the Entwash Vale
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Reeve of Entwash Vale</u> \qWe have arrived at Eaworth, capital of the Entwash Vale, bringing word of a vast Easterling horde invading from the north, but I fear that word has come too late, for Orcs are encamped upon Eaworth's threshold. I only hope that we can convince Reeve Ingbert of the greater threat facing the whole of Rohan....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Eaworth Under Siege
privateEncounter.description: <u>Eaworth Under Siege</u> \qOur message comes to the Entwash Vale at an inopportune time, for Orcs have already besieged the city of Eaworth. The Riders Four must now join with Reeve Ingbert and his allies to break the siege....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: In Defence of Eaworth
privateEncounter.description: <u>In Defence of Eaworth</u> \qAgainst my wishes, my son Ingmar has taken to the field against the Orcs of Maustazg. He thinks of the glory victory would bring him, but not the grief it would bring to those who love him should he perish....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Unbridled Wrath
privateEncounter.description: <u>Unbridled Wrath</u> \qRuin! Wrack and ruin! These Orcs and uruks have brought ruin to my home, and I will bring ruin to them! If it were not for that tree...or was it a giant? A giant tree? No matter...if it had not saved me, I would not be alive to take my revenge....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: In Defence of Eaworth
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Riders Four</u> \qWe were dispatched by Lord Éomer to harry the Orcs roving the plains of the Mark, but what we discovered in the Brown Lands was truly terrifying. Now we ride through the Eastemnet on our way to Edoras, warning the Reeves of the Easterling horde marching upon them....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Treasure of Rohan
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Treasure of Rohan</u> \qThe true treasure of Rohan does not lie in silver or gold, but in the herds of the noble horses which roam the plains of the Riddermark. Descended from the Mearas, these great beasts are prized by all, including the Dark Lord....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Wary Riders
privateEncounter.description: <u>Wary Riders</u> \qI know not why I am disturbed by Reeve Athelward's hospitality, but I sense that not all will be well for us if we remain. This night, we must leave Cliving like thieves, else danger takes us unaware....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Thirst for Blood
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Thirst for Blood</u> \qI of all my companions understand the thirst for blood. It burns in those who have seen tragedy...but Reeve Fastred must put aside his thirst, for a horde comes that knows no mercy, and only the blood of the Men of the Sutcrofts will be forfeit....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Troubled Friendship
privateEncounter.description: <u>Troubled Friendship</u> \qI know not why my friends Sperling and Brúnstan are fighting, but someone must stop them! I am afraid they are going to injure more than their friendship....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Strange Passers-by
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Strange Passers-by</u> \qThe Ent Ashlimb wishes to relay a memory to you, for something troubles his slow, sleepy mind.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Lost in Fangorn
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Lost in Fangorn</u> \qThe Ent Baillas wishes to impart a memory upon you, for something has piqued the interest of this sleepy, tree-ish creature.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Scattered Friends
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Scattered Friends</u> \qGandalf has found you deep in the eaves of Fangorn after you followed the trail of two lost hobbits. He wishes now to allay your worries for the vulnerable halflings and to tell you all that is afoot in Fangorn.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Missing Friend
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Missing Friend</u> \qAs Oldheart's memory unfolds, you feel long, long years of loneliness fluttering away as a tiny bird hops about the grass, peeping and cheeping away.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Awake at Long Last
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Awake At Long Last</u> \qYou have finally had some measure of success, for Oldheart seems quite awake for the first time in an age...but you are filled with trepidation, for some great power has woken with him. You feel it in your very bones.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Short of Stature, Great in Deed
privateEncounter.description: <u>Short of Stature, Great In Deed</u> \qI have been in this cage for what seems like days! Are my friends coming to rescue me or not? Should they even bother? They have probably left already.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Meet Harding
privateEncounter.description: <u>Meet Harding</u> \qHarding is the Thane of Harwick, Reeve of the Wold, and Aldor of the Northmarch, and the time has come to meet him....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Imping
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Imping</u> \qImping, one of the last Rohirrim sawmills along the Entwash, has fallen to invaders. Ethelbryt has tasked you with defeating the leader of these invaders in the hopes that such a demoralizing blow would weaken the enemy and allow the Rohirrim to retake the mill.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Iserngraf
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Iserngraf</u> \qThe Iserngraf is a source of much needed ore in Rohan. Mines this rich are sought by many and control of it is critical to the Rohirrim. Unfortunately, it has fallen under attack, and the miners have been driven out. Frithnoth has asked you to do what you can do discourage the invaders within.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Parphád
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Parphád</u> \qLong have the ruins of Parphád remained closed to the inquisitive and invaders alike. Not content with this, invaders have breached the gates of the ruins and threaten the relics contained within. Ascbert has tasked you with preserving the relics and texts within, even if that effort means confronting the invaders.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Welcome to Harwick
privateEncounter.description: <u>Welcome to Harwick</u> \qAldor Harding requests your presence, and you can only hope that he has heard of your diligent labours on behalf of Harwick.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Point of Decision
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Point of Decision</u> \qWe always knew that the Company of the Ring would face the difficult decision of what road to take. We simply did not know how soon....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Journey by Boat
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Journey by Boat</u> \qThe river Anduin is as familiar to me as my own shadow, but it is still a journey of some days. We must stop here for the night.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Two Hobbits
privateEncounter.description: <u>Two Hobbits</u> \qThose footprints are hobbit-sized! What became of our mutual friends on that dangerous day?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Horn of Gondor
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Horn of Gondor</u> \qSomeone cut a mighty swath through the Uruks in the East Wall, but was it enough to save our mutual friends from certain death?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Breaking of the Fellowship
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Breaking of the Fellowship</u> \qSomething happened to our mutual friends: the signs of it are everywhere in the East Wall. But did the danger come from without their number...or within?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Thane Mildrith
privateEncounter.description: <u>Thane Mildrith</u> \qElthengels is under attack! Quickly, my friends! We must help with its defence!\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Homecoming
privateEncounter.description: <u>Homecoming</u> \qI have been too long away from home. But what welcome awaits me now?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Stone of Wyrgende
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Stone of Wyrgende</u> \qI have business in Snowbourn, but first I would see Wyrgende's Stone. Will I next fall to the crone's curse?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Shield-brothers
privateEncounter.description: <u>Shield-brothers</u> \qElfmar is a good man and true, just like his father. We should help him prepare his men for battle as best we can.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Night Falls on Meduseld
privateEncounter.description: <u>Night Falls on Meduseld</u> \qMy uncle Théoden will listen to me and put right the situation with Reeve Fastred. He is still King in Rohan.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Pain of Regret
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: The Pain of Regret</u> \qLéofmar carries a deep guilt with him since his arrival in Fangorn, one that has led him to believe that he is cursed. He is ready to reveal to you the story behind his regret.\q

privateEncounter.name: Private Instance: The Tourney Field
privateEncounter.description:
<u>The Tourney Field: Mounted Combat Tutorial</u>
You have been granted a war-steed of prized Rohirrim stock. Now you must master your steed on the Tourney fields of Harwick, under the tutelage of the aged Rohirrim instructor, Seoca.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Dangerous Road
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Dangerous Road</u> \qHaving loaded their waggon and bid their friends good-bye, Runald's family departs from Elthengels. A most dangerous road lies before them....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Desire above Strength
privateEncounter.description: <u>Desire above Strength</u> \qIdes has quickly grown to trust you as a mentor. She wishes to discuss with you her aspirations and her fears.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Wrath of the Reeve
privateEncounter.description: <u>Wrath of the Reeve</u> \qI have taken to the battlefield, hoping to inspire and reassure my people. We fight together, and I wish to witness firsthand your ability in combat.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: All that Remains
privateEncounter.description: <u>All that Remains</u> \qYou have escorted Inhild to the home of Randgar, offering her the chance to have closure regarding the death of the man she once loved.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Defence of Faldham
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Defence of Faldham</u> \qThane Elfmar has rallied the Elfward for the coming assault against Faldham, hoping to repel the assembled White Hand force.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Shield-maiden's Training
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Shield-maiden's Training</u> \qThe desire to train against more unpredictable foes has drawn Ides' attention to the bears roaming just beyond the training grounds.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Sworn Oaths
privateEncounter.description: <u>Sworn Oaths</u> \qGarmund has rejected my commands to remain guarding the city. He has taken his éored to reclaim land from the Orcs, keeping his oath to protect the whole of the Norcrofts.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Floodwend Meadhall Besieged
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Mead Hall of Floodwend Besieged</u> \qThe Easterlings have regrouped and are poised to assault Floodwend. The attack comes as success is reported to Radwig, yet now the town finds itself in a struggle to keep the Mead Hall from falling to the enemy.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Lords of the Eastemnet
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Witan</u> \qSkeptical of the King's state of mind, the Lords of the Eastemnet have gathered to decide how to defend their lands.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Battle for Hytbold
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle for Hytbold</u> \qThe Enemy is marching upon Hytbold, intent upon defeating the Lords of the Eastemnet and claiming eastern Rohan as their own.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Caravan to Snowbourn
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Caravan to Snowbourn</u> \qFearing for the safety of my people, I have decreed that my son, Gísling, is to escort the crofters of Garsfeld to safety within the walls of Snowbourn. However, the road south is fraught with danger as foes approach from all directions....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Father of the Sutcrofts
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Father of the Sutcrofts</u> \qFastred, Reeve of the Sutcrofts, stands in silence at his father's grave -- a respite from his brutal assaults against the Orcs. His grief still fresh, he wishes to speak of Dagred's life and legacy before he takes his leave to Snowbourn.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The First Assault
privateEncounter.description: <u>The First Assault</u> \qSensing weakness in the humble crofting settlement of Walstow, the Orcs of Mordor have poured forth from the East Wall in hopes of claiming part of the Sutcrofts for their dark master.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: On These Stones
privateEncounter.description: <u>On These Stones</u> \qAmid the disappearance of Fastred's son and the siege of Walstow, a terrible sorceror of Mordor, Crúmgam, leads a vast force of Orcs in a ploy to bring Snowbourn and the entirety of the Eastemnet to ruin.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Down Payment
privateEncounter.description: <u>Down Payment</u> \qYou find the house that was purchased is not very well kept, and seems to have unwanted occupants...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Galadriel's Dream
privateEncounter.description: <u>Signs and Portents</u> \qThe dreaming mind sees much, and much is seen of it...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Greet the Sun
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Great Hall of Durin</u> \qYou have met a dwarf passing through Zelem-melek in the Great Hall of Durin, but it would seem that not all is well in his travels.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Iorbar's Peak
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Iorbar's Peak</u> \qA stone-giant dwelling upon Iorbar's Peak has taken an egg from the eyries of the Great Eagles. Gwaihir the Windlord has requested that you brave the storms of the mountain and safely secure the egg before it becomes the giant's next meal.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Webs of the Scuttledells
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Webs of the Scuttledells</u> \qThe Great Spiders of Mirkwood have begun to stir again, and the Elves of Thranduil, King of Mirkwood seek to learn the cause. What dire darkness has arisen within the wood to summon forth such evil?\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Seat of the Great Goblin
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Seat of the Great Goblin</u> \qThe denizens of Goblin-town have remained long in disarray after the death of the Great Goblin and their defeat at the Lonely Mountain. Whispers have travelled throughout the Misty Mountains of a new Great Goblin, a leader whose return could spell doom for the Free Peoples of Middle-earth.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Battle for Erebor
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle for Erebor</u> \qThe Easterlings in the North are dismayed by the news of defeats in the South, and the time has come to break the siege of Erebor. However, Sauron's champions await you at the gateway to the Lonely Mountain....\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Flight to the Lonely Mountain
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Flight to the Lonely Mountain</u> \qThe Ring has passed beyond my vision into the pass of Cirith Ungol. Dale has fallen in the North, and the survivors of the siege are retreating to the Lonely Mountain, with the Easterling forces not far behind them….\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Fires of Smaug
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Fires of Smaug</u> \qThe dwarves of Erebor wish to send forth ravens with news of the Battle of Dale and to request aid, but the Easterlings have constructed a device of great evil to smoke the dwarves out of the Lonely Mountain....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Greet the Sun
privateEncounter.description: <u>Greet the Sun</u> \qYou have reached the East Gate of Moria at last, after a long and strenuous journey through the dark.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Bells of Dale
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Bells of Dale</u> \qAid will not come to the Men of Gondor from the North, for in these last days of the Third Age, war has come to the foot of Erebor. Easterlings answering the call of the Dark Lord prepare to besiege Dale and the Lonely Mountain. The only comfort is that Mordor's host will also be bereft of these forces.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Greet the Sun
privateEncounter.description: <u>Those Who Came Before</u> \qYou feel a strong sort of tug to investigate the Bridge of Khazad-dûm once more....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Cease to Resist
privateEncounter.description: <u>Cease to Resist</u> \qYou have arrived at the location of the ancient forge, high atop Hurmulkezer. The ancient forge has not been used for some time and is capable of creating powerful weapons.\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: Many Worries
privateEncounter.description: <u>Many Worries</u> \qMeanwhile, Halbarad of the Dúnedain struggles to decide the best course of action for the Rangers under his command.\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: One More Journey
privateEncounter.description: <u>One More Journey</u> \qMeanwhile, Saeradan of the Dúnedain travels north with the bodies of his fallen brethren, determined to lay them to rest.\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: The Ox and the Dragon
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Ox and the Dragon</u> \qMeanwhile, Radanir of the Dúnedain brings tidings of Lheu Brenin's betrayal to the Uch-lûth in Enedwaith.\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: Halros's Watch
privateEncounter.description: <u>Halros's Watch</u> \qMeanwhile, in the Shire, Halros of the Dúnedain helps watch the borders of that land and hopes his brethren in the south are faring well on their journey.\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: Halros's Watch
privateEncounter.description: <u>Halros's Watch</u> \qMeanwhile, in Dunland, Halros of the Dúnedain has been woken for his turn at the watch.\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: Calenglad's Appeal
privateEncounter.description: <u>Calenglad's Appeal</u> \qMeanwhile, Calenglad of the Dúnedain seeks for answers in the forest of the Mournshaws.\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: Pit of the Falcon
privateEncounter.description: <u>Pit of the Falcon</u> \qMeanwhile, in Tâl Methedras, the thirst for vengeance drives Golodir of the Dúnedain to seek out Lheu Brenin, the treacherous leader of the Falcon Clan.\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: Strength of Will
privateEncounter.description: <u>Pit of the Falcon</u> \qMeanwhile, in the dungeons below Isengard, Lothrandir of the Dúnedain resists the torments of his captors.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Day the Giant Came
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Day the Giant Came</u> \qNow that the escapees from Dunfast have recovered their strength and their hope, you must endeavour to pry their tale from them.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Ost Dunhoth - Disease and Poison Wing
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Ost Dunhoth</u> \qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition...\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Ost Dunhoth - Gortheron Wing
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Ost Dunhoth</u> \qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition...\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Ost Dunhoth - Wound and Fear Wing
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Ost Dunhoth</u> \qFrom behind the walls of Ost Dunhoth, a terrible foe sends his malice out into Middle-earth. Gortheron, greatest of the Gaunt-lords, must be defeated before his plans can come to fruition...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Story of a Strange Stone
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Story of a Strange Stone</u> \qThere is a story behind the stone fragment you uncovered in Dunfast...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Funeral in Forlaw
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Funeral in Forlaw</u> \qThe people of Forlaw gather to mourn those lost in the battle of Scylfig. Most notably, their champion, Thrymm Red-beard... and with him they bury any hope of surviving this war.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Remembering Thrymm
privateEncounter.description: <u>Remembering Thrymm</u> \qThrymm Red-beard, the champion of Forlaw, proudly carries the hope of the people of Wildermore. He was one of the few to heed the call to defend an incoming attack on an early morning in Forlaw...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Thrymm's Farm
privateEncounter.description: <u>Thrymm's Farm</u> \qThrymm's Farm is on the verge of recovery, but their efforts may be for nothing should the Warg-riders return.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Defence of Scylfig
privateEncounter.description: <u>Defence of Scylfig</u> \qThe people of Scylfig have been dreading this moment for quite a while. Now is the time for everyone to take up arms and defend Scylfig with their lives!\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Snows Come Again
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Snows Come Again</u> \qYou cannot ignore the shiver that travels down your spine as the cold air creeps in over Byre Tor.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Helm's Deep Prototype - Render
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: Helm's Deep Prototype - Render Test

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Unnatural Winter
privateEncounter.description: <u>Unnatural Winter</u> \qI was born in Dunfast, many years ago. What has happened to the village I remember?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Snows Come Again
privateEncounter.description: <u>Isolation Amongst the Survivors</u> \qBefore you move on from the Steaping Cave, you would like to see the other women be more kind to Ránmald, who is in a fragile state.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Running Towards Nothing
privateEncounter.description: <u>Running Towards Nothing</u> \qGreat and terrible things lurk in the dark of the forest. If any of the refugees from Byre Tor yet survive, they will need aid.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Days Long Past
privateEncounter.description: <u>Days Long Past</u> \qSheltered from the evil that has taken hold of the forest, Barallas wishes to recall the days before Núrzum's coming, when the Ents once met at the Enting Hollow.\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Thrymm's Farm
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Thrymm's Farm

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Waters of the Whitshaws
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Waters of the Whitshaws

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Celebration of Scylfig
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Celebration of Scylfig

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Shattered Roots
privateEncounter.description: <u>Shattered Roots</u> \qAfter conversing with the trees of Balewood, Mossbeard has learned horrifying truths of Núrzum's origins and the fate of the elder Huorn, Brúndoron.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Man and Monster
privateEncounter.description: <u>Man and Monster</u> \qThe Ent, Mossbeard, wishes to tell you more of what he has learned from the trees of Balewood. Núrzum's might stems not from within, but from the vile stone upon his back granted to him by a powerful benefactor.\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Writhendowns
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Writhendowns

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Whitshaws Plains
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Whitshaws Plains

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Whitshaws Plains
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: Whitshaws Plains

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: The Northern Road
privateEncounter.description: Public Instance: The Northern Road

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Bloom
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Bloom</u> \qCorudan says they have planted the seed of Núrzum's defeat, and we need only wait for it to bloom. Is he right? Can we trust this Ent?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Núrzum
privateEncounter.description: <u>Núrzum</u> \qWhile I remain behind, my friends journey to Byre Tor to see what they can learn of Núrzum. Perhaps I worry unnecessarily, but what will I do if they are unable to return?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Trail of Vengeance
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Trail of Vengeance</u> \qYou and Cyneberg have come upon a trail of slaughtered Orcs, with no idea who may have killed them.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Núrzum's Wrath
privateEncounter.description: <u>Núrzum's Wrath</u> \qNúrzum has sown discord throughout Wildermore, but nowhere was the power of the stone felt greater than where his path of destruction began deep in Balewood.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Disturbance At the Gate
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Disturbance At the Gate</u> \qGárwig, the Reeve of Wildermore, has been summoned by a disturbance at the western gate of Forlaw.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Forest for the Trees
privateEncounter.description: <u>Forest for the Trees</u> \qRepulsed by the destruction the White Hand and Núrzum have caused in the forest, the Ents of Balewood march to war.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Final Stand
privateEncounter.description: <u>Last Stand</u> \qWildermore has suffered enough loss and heartbreak to last its people many lifetimes. With the return of Thrymm, the hero of the land, it is time for Núrzum's reign of terror to come to an end.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Helm's Dike - Fellowship
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Helm's Dike</u> \qHelm's Dike forms the first barrier of defence for Rohan's final stand. The rearguard left here must buy time for the defenders to prepare the fortress and wall for the oncoming siege. Saruman's army marches, angry and ready for war.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Glittering Caves - Small Fellowship
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Glittering Caves</u> \qThe Glittering Caves of Aglarond are where the women, children, and supplies have been hidden. With the loss of the Wall and the Deeping-comb, Gimli, Gamling, and Eómer now rally any they can find to hold the line and protect all huddled within.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Deeping Wall - Raid
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Deeping Wall</u> \qThe dike has been overrun. Now, the full weight of Saruman's army prepares to crash down upon the valiant defenders upon the ramparts of the Deeping Wall. The wall must stand or the fortress will surely fall.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Glittering Caves - Solo
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Glittering Caves</u> \qThe Glittering Caves of Aglarond are where the women, children, and supplies have been hidden. With the loss of the Wall and the Deeping-comb, Gimli, Gamling, and Eómer now rally any they can find to hold the line and protect all huddled within.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Deeping Wall - Solo
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Deeping Wall</u> \qThe dike has been overrun. Now, the full weight of Saruman's army prepares to crash down upon the valiant defenders upon the ramparts of the Deeping Wall. The wall must stand or the fortress will surely fall.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Deeping-coomb - Solo
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Deeping-coomb</u> \qSaruman's foul sorcery has destroyed the Deeping Wall and driven the Rohirrim into the Deeping-coomb. The retreat to the Glittering Caves and the Hornburg must be secured if there is to be any hope.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: Helm's Dike - Solo
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>Helm's Dike</u> \qHelm's Dike forms the first barrier of defence for Rohan's final stand. The rearguard left here must buy time for the defenders to prepare the fortress and wall for the oncoming siege. Saruman's army marches, angry and ready for war.\q

skirmishPrivateEncounter.name: The Hornburg - Solo
skirmishPrivateEncounter.description: <u>The Hornburg</u> \qThe Hornburg is all that stands between Saruman's army and the fall of Rohan. Aragorn stands defiant upon the ramparts of the gatehouse. Dawn will come soon.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Last Great Stronghold
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Last Great Stronghold</u> \qThéoden's company parted from Gandalf upon the road and retreated to Helm's Deep. What news could have reached them that turned them from their path?'\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Journey to Helm's Deep
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Journey to Helm's Deep</u> \qActing as Thane, Agelwyn must now venture out and lead her people to the safety of the Hornburg, where Théoden King plans to make his stand against the vast forces of Isengard.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Reluctant Young Leader
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Reluctant Young Thane</u> \qAgelwyn, the young wife of Thane Gladsúnu of Marton, has a difficult task set before her in her husband's absence as she awaits his return. Their town has fallen, and the people of Marton need a leader now more than ever.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Lady's Champion
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Lady's Champion</u> \qBrigands out of the Stonedeans plot to murder Lady Lúfa, the young wife of Thane Ordlac of Oserley. The Thane has devised a plan of his own that appears to heartlessly use his wife as bait for the trap....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Forth the Toringas
privateEncounter.description: <u>Forth the Toringas</u> \qThane Tordag of Torsbury, determined to reclaim his town from the Dunlending invaders, has joined with Dudsig of Oserley to march upon his ruined village....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Council of Stoke
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Council of Stoke</u> \qAt the prompting of her advisors, Reeve Fríthild of the Broadacres has summoned together a war-council to determine how best to deal with the threat posed by the forces of the White Hand....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Council of Stoke
privateEncounter.description: <u>Shield-maiden of Rohan</u> \qTo appease the grief of Reeve Fríthild's children, Thane Ordlac has chosen to hold a private -- and unsettlingly cheerful -- funeral for the late Reeve of the Broadacres....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Council of Stoke
privateEncounter.description: <u>Celebration of Victory</u> \qDespite Reeve Fríthild's misgivings with the victory at Bardh-dorám, Thane Ordlac has prompted her to hold a celebration feast....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Council of Stoke
privateEncounter.description: <u>Ride Against the Goblins</u> \qBaldmund, leader of the refugees from Torsbury, convinced Reeve Fríthild that the first threat they should deal with are the Warg-riders in the east, which prevent the hunters of Stoke from provisioning the townsfolk for the coming siege....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Council of Stoke
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Broadacres Betrayed</u> \qThane Ordlac, revealed to be the traitor who orchestrated Reeve Fríthild's death, has claimed regency of the Broadacres and the Reeve's children. Young Thane Torferth of Torsbury prepares to ride against Stoke and take back the seat of the Reeve....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Council of Stoke
privateEncounter.description: <u>Assault on Bardh-dorám</u> \qThane Ordlac of Oserley convinced Reeve Fríthild to put an end to the White Hand's invasion once and for all by leading an assault against their camp of Bardh-dorám....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Hildith's Council
privateEncounter.description: <u>Hildith's Council</u> \qHildith, the headstrong wife of Grimbold, now leads Grimslade in her husband's absence.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Aldburg Convenes
privateEncounter.description: <u>Aldburg Convenes</u> \qThane Arcil and Éothain have gathered in the Mead Hall of Aldburg to state their cases and weigh the options that will afford the most benefit to Aldburg.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Grimslade Will Burn
privateEncounter.description: <u>Grimslade Will Burn</u> \qThe half-orc prisoner, terrified of burning along with Grimslade, has disclosed a planned attack by the servants of Saruman.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Fords Have Fallen
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Fords Have Fallen</u> \qFollowing the death of Théodred, the servants of the White Hand launch a second attack upon Elfhelm and Grimbold at the Fords of Isen....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Gemyndsted
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Gemyndsted</u> \qYou have followed Quickbeam's directions to the Library at Gemyndsted. Clear the forces of Saruman from inside and reclaim any relics and texts within.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Instance: The Council of Herubrand
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Council of Herubrand</u> \qHerubrand meets with his advisors to discuss the actions that they should take in response to the assault upon the Mead Hall of Woodhurst.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Lady Éowyn's Charge
privateEncounter.description: <u>Lady Éowyn's Charge</u> \qThe Lady Éowyn of the House of Eorl has been charged with protecting the people of Edoras. Soon, she will lead them to Dunharrow in the south as the forces of Isengard begin to close in.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Théoden, Son of Thengel
privateEncounter.description: <u>Théoden, Son of Thengel</u> \qWe have returned to Meduseld, against the King's orders, but we do not seem to be the only ones come to the Golden Hall to speak words of warning....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Commands of the King
privateEncounter.description: <u>Commands of the King</u> \qThéoden King has stepped beyond his hall to look upon the kingdom. What will he see, I wonder? And will it move him to strike down the evils arrayed against his people?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The King Rides West
privateEncounter.description: <u>The King Rides West</u> \qThéoden King has mustered a force of more than a thousand spears and prepares to ride for Isengard. Will he return to Edoras in this life?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Eyes of Edoras
privateEncounter.description: <u>Eyes of Edoras</u> \qWe have returned to Edoras and should see how Éowyn fares with her duties.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Soothsayer
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Soothsayer</u> \qRubbish and nonsense. Herubrand may believe the words of this soothsayer, but I will not fall for her trickery.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Mustering
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Mustering</u> \qGrimbold has fallen into a deep gloom since the death Prince Théodred, and deeper still when Elfhelm and the Rohirrim abandoned him. He now awaits death as the last defender of the Fords.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Stangraf
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Stangraf</u> \qThe mines of Stangraf have been overrun by the forces of Isengard. Stangraf contains a wealth of resources that must not fall into Saruman's hands. Remove the invaders, and recover as many resources as you can.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Direnfirel
privateEncounter.description: <u>Instance: Direnfirel</u> \qDirenfirel is a small lumber-mill that is now under the control of Saruman's forces. Remove the forces of Isengard from the area and gather what resources you can carry back with you.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Liberating Woodhurst
privateEncounter.description: <u>Liberating Woodhurst</u> \qSensing that Woodhurst suffers from a lack of leadership, powerful men seek to guide the city in a direction that favours them.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Siege Escalated
privateEncounter.description: <u>Siege Escalated</u> \qThe White Hand is pressing its assault upon Brockbridge, and the few defending it will be hard-pressed to survive.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Hard Negotiations
privateEncounter.description: <u>Hard Negotiations</u> \qIn the grim aftermath of the Wade-slaught, Thane Edric journeys to Edoras to confront Éowyn on matters of honour and duty.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Stilling the Wade
privateEncounter.description: <u>Stilling the Wade</u> \qSeeking to avenge the wrongs done to her people, Éowyn rides east to drive the White Hand from the Wade once and for all.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: In Need of Cheering-up
privateEncounter.description: <u>In Need of Cheering-up</u> \qWhile the Lady Éowyn appears brave and cheerful, some who know her well grow concerned for her, for she does not eat or sleep, and a heavy gloom seems to have settled upon her since the departure of Théoden King.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Trading Fates
privateEncounter.description: <u>Trading Fates</u> \qHaving seen his people ride to safety at Edoras, Thane Mágla awaits death in his Mead Hall as the White Hand prepares to raze Middlemead.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Fiddle and the Drum
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Fiddle and the Drum</u> \qLong at odds with the glory-seeking Éowyn, Ellen Fremedon of Underharrow finds herself overwhelmed by the task of sheltering the helpless of Rohan.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Road to Dunharrow
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Road to Dunharrow</u> \qUpon the plains of the Firienfeld at Dunharrow, the people of Kingstead have at last found shelter. Yet at the edge of the Dimholt, a sudden wave of dread flows over Éowyn and her people.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Need for Words
privateEncounter.description: <u>A Need for Words</u> \qThe men atop the wall need words of inspiration if they are to stand against Saruman's armies.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Missing
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Missing</u> \qWe have tracked the Orcs to the cave of Burg-shápol, but will we find the captive craftsmen in time?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Legend of Folca
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Legend of Folca</u> \qMeregyth, daughter of the Thane of Fenmarch, retells the story of King Folca the Hunter and the Boar of Everholt. This tale of bravery and vengeance may illuminate details of history that were lost.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Woodhurst Has Fallen
privateEncounter.description: <u>Woodhurst Has Fallen</u> \qA dark power waited in the shadows of Woodhurst for the moment to strike and watched while the city's champions squabbled among themselves. Now residing on the seat as Woodhurst's conqueror, the champions may be too weak to purge its growing influence....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Invitation for a Drink
privateEncounter.description: <u>Invitation for a Drink</u> \qArnwi invited Calin for a drink at the nearby inn. Herubrand is suspicious and requested you accompany Calin....\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: The Doorward
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Doorward</u> \qWe have victory this day, but it was not assured. Were it not for the deeds of Háma, doorward of Théoden, all might have been lost....\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Secret Ways
privateEncounter.description: <u>Secret Ways</u> \qDo not be blinded by the beauty of the Glittering Caves, my friend! We must see to the safety of the folk that shelter here!\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Let's Take the Hornburg!
privateEncounter.description: <u>Let's Take the Hornburg!</u> \qYou have survived the long night standing before the walls of the Hornburg, and it is time to take your prize at last. The horse-men must fall!\q

privateEncounter.name: Epic Battles: Basic Training
privateEncounter.description: <u>Epic Battles: Basic Training</u> \qThe armies of Saruman approach. Will we be ready to face them?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Breaking the Back of the Boar
privateEncounter.description: <u>Breaking the Back of the Boar</u> \qPakon, the Chieftain of the Maldorr Orcs has long plotted revenge against Folca's line. If not stopped, he will have his long-sought vengeance.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Allies Unexpected
privateEncounter.description: <u>Allies Unexpected</u> \qAfter a short rest, the company sets out for Isengard and finds the road greatly changed...\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: Last March of the Ents
privateEncounter.description: <u>Last March of the Ents</u> \qWe marched... marched... marched to war... to Isengard...\q

privateEncounter.name: Interlude: The Moot
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Moot</u> \qPip and I had escaped into Fangorn Forest, but we did not know if we would find safety under the eaves...\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Lothrandir
privateEncounter.description: <u>Lothrandir</u> \qThere are many hidden rooms within the ring of Isengard. Does my kinsman live still within one of these chambers?\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Laying to Rest the Evil Dead
privateEncounter.description: <u>Laying to Rest the Evil Dead</u> \qHeralded by the demise of the gaunt-man Gúrdring, Glorfindel fears the return of Ferndúr the Virulent to the Trollshaws. Hoping to strike before Ferndúr's strength grows too great, Glorfindel has enlisted your aid in quelling the threat posed by this ancient Gaunt-lord of Morgoth.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: The Battle for Dol Amroth
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle for Dol Amroth</u> \qCorsairs from the south have taken the fortress city of Dol Amroth. Together with the Swan-knights, you must aid in recapturing it.\q

privateEncounter.name: Public Instance: Tol Fennas
privateEncounter.description: <u>The Battle for Dol Amroth</u> \qCorsairs from the south have taken the fortress city of Dol Amroth. Together with the Swan-knights, you must aid in recapturing it.\q

privateEncounter.name: Instance: Tol Aduial
privateEncounter.description: Instance: Tol Aduial

privateEncounter.name: Instance: A Hard-earned Meal
